text2: « Te maa ngi leen koy wax , képp ku ma nangu ci kanamu nit ñi , Doomu nit ki dina la nangu ci kanamu malaakay Yàlla yi .

text: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God .
text2: Waaye ku ma gàntu ci kanamu nit ñi , dinañu la gàntu ci kanamu malaakay Yàlla yi .

text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven .
text2: Ku sosal Doomu nit ki , dinañu la baal , waaye kuy sosal Xel mu Sell mi , duñu la ko baal .

text: And when they bring you unto the synagogues , and unto magistrates , and powers , take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall answer , or what ye shall say :
text2: « Bu ñu leen yóbboo ca jàngu ya , ca kanamu kilifa ya ak àttekat ya , buleen am xel ñaar ci li ngeen war a tontu ak nan ngeen war a tontoo , walla lu ngeen war a wax ,

text: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say .
text2: ndaxte Xel mu Sell mi dina leen xamal ca waxtu woowa li ngeen war a wax . »

text: And one of the company said unto him , Master , speak to my brother , that he divide the inheritance with me .
text2: Am ca mbooloo ma ku ne Yeesu : « Kilifa gi , joxal ndigal sama mag , mu sédd ma ci sunu ndono . »

text: And he said unto him , Man , who made me a judge or a divider over you ?
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Sama waay , kan moo ma fal àttekat ci seen kaw , walla mu teg ma fi , ma di leen séddaleel seen alal ? »

text: And he said unto them , Take heed , and beware of covetousness : for a man ' s life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth .
text2: Noonu mu ne leen ñoom ñépp : « Moytuleen bëgge , ndaxte bakkanu nit ajuwul ci alalam , ak lu mu baree - bare . »

text: And he spake a parable unto them , saying , The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully :
text2: Noonu mu dégtal leen wii léeb ne : « Dafa amoon waa ju bare alal , te ay toolam nangu lool ,

text: And he thought within himself , saying , What shall I do , because I have no room where to bestow my fruits ?
text2: muy werante ci xelam naan : “ Nu ma war a def ? Ndaxte amatuma fu ma dajale sama ngóob mi . ”

text: And he said , This will I do : I will pull down my barns , and build greater ; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods .
text2: Noonu mu ne : “ Nii laay def : daaneel sama sàq yi , defaraat yu gën a réy , ba man cee dajale sama dugub ji ak sama am - am jépp .

text: And I will say to my soul , Soul , thou hast much goods laid up for many years ; take thine ease , eat , drink , and be merry .
text2: Te dinaa kañ sama bopp ne : ’ Yaw mii , am nga alal ju bare ju man a dem ay ati at ; noppalal sa yaram , di lekk , di naan , tey bég . ’ ”

text: But God said unto him , Thou fool , this night thy soul shall be required of thee : then whose shall those things be , which thou hast provided ?
text2: Waaye Yàlla ne ko : “ Ñàkk xel ! Guddig tey , dees na jël sa bakkan . Kon li nga dajale lépp , ku koy moom ? ”

text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself , and is not rich toward God .
text2: « Kiy dajale alal ngir boppam nag te amul dara ca kanam Yàlla , lu mel nii moo lay dal . »

text: And he said unto his disciples , Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat ; neither for the body , what ye shall put on .
text2: Noonu Yeesu daldi ne taalibeem yi : « Loolu moo tax maa ngi leen koy wax , buleen seen bakkan jaaxal , ci lu ngeen war a lekk . Buleen jaaxle it ngir seen yaram ci lu ngeen war a sol ,

text: The life is more than meat , and the body is more than raiment .
text2: ndaxte bakkan moo gën lekk , te yaram a gën koddaay .

text: Consider the ravens : for they neither sow nor reap ; which neither have storehouse nor barn ; and God feedeth them : how much more are ye better than the fowls ?
text2: Seetleen baaxoñ yi : duñu ji , duñu góob , amuñu dencukaay , amuñu sàq , teewul Yàllaa ngi leen di dundal . Céy ni ngeen ëppe maana picc yi !

text: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit ?
text2: Ana kan ci yéen ci kaw njaaxleem , moo man a yokk ab waxtu ci àppam ?

text: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least , why take ye thought for the rest ?
text2: Su fekkee lu tuuti loolu rekk mënuleen koo def , kon lu tax ngeen di jaaxle ci li ci des ?

text: Consider the lilies how they grow : they toil not , they spin not ; and yet I say unto you , that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: « Seetleen ni tóor - tóori ñax mi di saxe . Duñu liggéey , duñu ëcc , waaye maa ngi leen di wax ne , Suleymaan sax ci ndamam , soluwul woon ni benn ci ñoom .

text: If then God so clothe the grass , which is to day in the field , and to morrow is cast into the oven ; how much more will he clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: Yéen ñi néew ngëm ! Bu Yàlla woddee nii ñaxu tool yi , miy sax tey te bu subaa ñu def ko ci taal bi , ndax du leen gën a wodd ?

text: And seek not ye what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink , neither be ye of doubtful mind .
text2: Buleen di wut lu ngeen di lekk walla lu ngeen di naan ; te buleen ci jaaxle .

text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after : and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things .
text2: Ndaxte loolu lépp , ñi xamul Yàlla ñoo koy wut . Te seen Baay xam na ne , soxla ngeen ko .

text: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Waaye wutleen nguuram , te loolu lépp dina leen ko ci dollil .

text: Fear not , little flock ; for it is your Father ' s good pleasure to give you the kingdom .
text2: « Buleen ragal dara , yéen coggal ju ndaw ji , ndaxte dafa soob seen Baay , mu jagleel leen nguuram .

text: Sell that ye have , and give alms ; provide yourselves bags which wax not old , a treasure in the heavens that faileth not , where no thief approacheth , neither moth corrupteth .
text2: Jaayleen seen alal , saraxe ko , ngir sàkku ay mbuusi xaalis yu dul bënn , maanaam alal ju dul jeex ca laaxira ; foofa sàcc du ko jege te max du ko yàq .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Ndaxte fu sa alal nekk , fa la sa xol nekk itam .

text: Let your loins be girded about , and your lights burning ;
text2: « Takkuleen bu dëgër te bàyyi làmp yi tàkk .

text: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their lord , when he will return from the wedding ; that when he cometh and knocketh , they may open unto him immediately .
text2: Mel - leen ni ay surga yuy xaar seen njaatige buy jóge ca céet ga , ndax bu fëggee bunt ba , ñu ubbil ko ca saa sa .

text: Blessed are those servants , whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching : verily I say unto you , that he shall gird himself , and make them to sit down to meat , and will come forth and serve them .
text2: Surga yooyee seen njaatige fekkul ñuy nelaw , ba mu agsee , ñoo gën a yeyoo ngërëm . Ci dëgg maa ngi leen koy wax , njaatige bi dina sol yérey waañ , wax leen ñu toog lekk , ba noppi indil leen ñam wi .

text: And if he shall come in the second watch , or come in the third watch , and find them so , blessed are those servants .
text2: Su fekkee seen njaatige ci xaaju guddi lay ñëw sax , walla bu suuf seddee , te fekk leen noonu , surga yooyu ñoo gën a yeyoo ngërëm .

text: And this know , that if the goodman of the house had known what hour the thief would come , he would have watched , and not have suffered his house to be broken through .
text2: Waaye xamleen lii : bu boroom kër gi xamoon ban waxtu la sàcc bi di ñëw , du ko bàyyi , mu toj këram .

text: Be ye therefore ready also : for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not .
text2: Yéen itam taxawleen jonn , ndaxte Doomu nit ki dina ñëw ci waxtu wu ngeen ko séenuwul . »

text: Then Peter said unto him , Lord , speakest thou this parable unto us , or even to all ?
text2: Piyeer ne Yeesu : « Boroom bi , ndax dangay dégtal léeb wii ngir nun rekk walla ngir mbooloo mépp ? »

text: And the Lord said , Who then is that faithful and wise steward , whom his lord shall make ruler over his household , to give them their portion of meat in due season ?
text2: Boroom bi tontu ko ne : « Kan moo nekk surga bu takku te teey , bu njaatigeem teg ci waa kër gi , ngir mu leen di dundal ci jamono ji ?

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Bu njaatigeem ñëwee te gis mu def noonu , surga boobu dina am ngërëm .

text: Of a truth I say unto you , that he will make him ruler over all that he hath .
text2: Ci dëgg maa ngi leen koy wax , njaatige bi dina ko teg ci alalam jépp .

text: But and if that servant say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ; and shall begin to beat the menservants and maidens , and to eat and drink , and to be drunken ;
text2: Waaye su fekkee surga ba da ne ci xelam : “ Sama njaatige day yéex a ñëw , ” ba tax mu tàmbalee dóor surga ya ca des ak mbindaan ya , di lekk te di naan , di màndi ,

text: The lord of that servant will come in a day when he looketh not for him , and at an hour when he is not aware , and will cut him in sunder , and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers .
text2: kon njaatige ba dina ñëw ci bés bu mu ko séenuwul ak waxtu wu mu xamul . Dina ko dóor ay dóor yu metti , jox ko añub ñi gëmul Yàlla .

text: And that servant , which knew his lord ' s will , and prepared not himself , neither did according to his will , shall be beaten with many stripes .
text2: « Surga bi xam bëgg - bëggu njaatigeem , te waajul mbaa mu takku def ko , dinañu ko dóor dóor yu metti .

text: But he that knew not , and did commit things worthy of stripes , shall be beaten with few stripes . For unto whomsoever much is given , of him shall be much required : and to whom men have committed much , of him they will ask the more .
text2: Waaye surga bi xamul bëgg - bëggu njaatigeem , te def lu yelloo ay dóor , dinañu ko dóor dóor yu néew . Ku ñu jox lu bare dees na la feyiku lu bare . Ku ñu dénk lu bare , dees na la laajaat lu ko ëpp .

text: I am come to send fire on the earth ; and what will I if it be already kindled ?
text2: « Damaa ñëw ngir indi safara si ci àddina , te bëgg naa xaat taal bi tàkk .

text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with ; and how am I straitened till it be accomplished !
text2: Fàww ñu sóob ma ci metit , te ba looluy mat , duma noppalu .

text: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth ? I tell you , Nay ; but rather division :
text2: Ndax dangeen a xalaat ne , damaa ñëw ngir indi jàmm ci àddina ? Déedéet . Maa ngi leen koy wax , damaa ñëw ngir indi féewaloo .

text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided , three against two , and two against three .
text2: Gannaawsi tey , bu juróomi nit bokkee genn kër , dinañu féewaloo . Ñett dinañu féewaloo ak ñaar ñi ci des , ñaar ñi féewaloo ak ñett ñooñu .

text: The father shall be divided against the son , and the son against the father ; the mother against the daughter , and the daughter against the mother ; the mother in law against her daughter in law , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Baay bi dina féewaloo ak doom ji , doom ji ak baayam . Ndey dina féewaloo ak doomam ju jigéen ; doom ju jigéen ji ak ndeyam . Goro dina féewaloo ak jabaru doomam ; jabaru nit ak goroom . »

text: And he said also to the people , When ye see a cloud rise out of the west , straightway ye say , There cometh a shower ; and so it is .
text2: Yeesu neeti mbooloo ma : « Bu ngeen gisee mu xiin ci sowu , dangeen naan ca saa sa : “ Dina taw , ” te mooy am .

text: And when ye see the south wind blow , ye say , There will be heat ; and it cometh to pass .
text2: Te bu ngeen yégee ngelaw liy uppe sudd , ngeen ne : “ Dina tàng tàngaay wu metti , ” te mooy am .

text: Ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky and of the earth ; but how is it that ye do not discern this time ?
text2: Naaféq yi ngeen doon ! Man ngeen a ràññee melow asamaan ak suuf , waaye lu tax mënuleen a ràññee li jamonoy léegi ji di tekki ?

text: Yea , and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right ?
text2: « Lu tax it dungeen àtteel seen bopp liy jëf ju jub ?

text: When thou goest with thine adversary to the magistrate , as thou art in the way , give diligence that thou mayest be delivered from him ; lest he hale thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and the officer cast thee into prison .
text2: Bu la nit jiiñee dara , ba ngeen ànd di dem ca àttekat ba , nanga fexee juboo ak moom ci yoon wi . Lu ko moy , dina la yóbbu ci yoon , yoon jébbal la ca loxoy alkaati ba , mu tëj la .

text: I tell thee , thou shalt not depart thence , till thou hast paid the very last mite .
text2: Maa ngi la koy wax , doo génn foofa mukk te feyuloo fiftin bi ci mujj . »

text: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans , whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices .
text2: Ca jamono jooju ay nit ñëw ca Yeesu , nettali mbirum waa Galile , ya Pilaat reylu woon , jaxase seen deret ak dereti mala , yi ñu rendi woon , jébbal leen Yàlla .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans , because they suffered such things ?
text2: Mu tontu leen ne : « Mbaa du dangeen a xalaat ne , waa Galile yooyu dañoo gën a nekk bàkkaarkat ña ca des , ndax coono bi ñu daj ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Maa ngi leen di wax ne , du dëgg . Waaye su ngeen tuubul seeni bàkkaar , dingeen sànku noonu , yéen ñépp itam .

text: Or those eighteen , upon whom the tower in Siloam fell , and slew them , think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem ?
text2: Te fukki nit ak juróom - ñett ñooñu dee , bi taaxum kaw ma ca goxu Silowe daanoo ci seen kaw , ndax dangeen a yaakaar ne , ñoo gën a nekk ay tooñkat ñeneen ñi dëkk Yerusalem yépp ?

text: I tell you , Nay : but , except ye repent , ye shall all likewise perish .
text2: Maa ngi leen di wax ne , du dëgg . Waaye su ngeen tuubul seeni bàkkaar , dingeen sànku noonu , yéen ñépp itam . »

text: He spake also this parable ; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard ; and he came and sought fruit thereon , and found none .
text2: Noonu mu daldi leen wax léeb wii : « Nit amoon na ci toolam garab gu ñu naan figg . Benn bés mu ñëw di ko raas - si , fekku fa benn doom .

text: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard , Behold , these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree , and find none : cut it down ; why cumbereth it the ground ?
text2: Noonu mu ne surga ba : “ Ñetti at a ngii may ñëw di raas - si garab gii te duma ci fekk dara . Gor ko . Lu tax muy xatal tool bi ? ”

text: And he answering said unto him , Lord , let it alone this year also , till I shall dig about it , and dung it :
text2: Surga ba tontu ko ne : “ Sang bi , bàyyiwaat ko fi at mii . Dinaa wàqi taat wi , def ci tos .

text: And if it bear fruit , well : and if not , then after that thou shalt cut it down .
text2: Xëy na dina meññi . Bu ko deful , nga gor ko . ” »

text: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath .
text2: Benn bésu noflaay Yeesoo ngi doon jàngale ci ab jàngu .

text: And , behold , there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years , and was bowed together , and could in no wise lift up herself .
text2: Amoon na fa jigéen ju rab jàppoon , ba feebarloo ko lu war a mat fukki at ak juróom - ñett ; dafa xuuge woon te mënul woon a siggi dara .

text: And when Jesus saw her , he called her to him , and said unto her , Woman , thou art loosed from thine infirmity .
text2: Bi ko Yeesu gisee , mu woo ko ne ko : « Soxna si , sa feebar deñ na . »

text: And he laid his hands on her : and immediately she was made straight , and glorified God .
text2: Noonu mu teg ko ay loxoom , soxna sa siggi ca saa sa , di màggal Yàlla .

text: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation , because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day , and said unto the people , There are six days in which men ought to work : in them therefore come and be healed , and not on the sabbath day .
text2: Waaye njiitu jàngu ba mer , ndax li Yeesu fajoon nit ca bésu noflaay ba , mu ne mbooloo ma : « Am na juróom - benni fan yu nit ñi war a liggéey . Kon war ngeen a ñëw faju ci bés yooyu , waaye du ci bésu noflaay bi . »

text: The Lord then answered him , and said , Thou hypocrite , doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall , and lead him away to watering ?
text2: Boroom bi tontu ko : « Naaféq yi ! Ndax bésu noflaay bi , kenn ku nekk ci yéen du yiwee ca gétt ga yëkkam walla mbaamam ngir wëggi ko ?

text: And ought not this woman , being a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan hath bound , lo , these eighteen years , be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day ?
text2: Jigéen jii nag bokk ci askanu Ibraayma te Seytaane tënk ko fukki at ak juróom - ñett , ndax kenn waru koo yiwi ci bésu noflaay bi ? »

text: And when he had said these things , all his adversaries were ashamed : and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him .
text2: Naka la wax loolu , noonam yépp daldi rus , waaye mbooloo mi di bég ci jëf yu yéeme , yi mu doon def yépp .

text: Then said he , Unto what is the kingdom of God like ? and whereunto shall I resemble it ?
text2: Noonu Yeesu neeti : « Lan la nguuru Yàlla di nirool ? Lan laa ko man a mengaleel ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and cast into his garden ; and it grew , and waxed a great tree ; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it .
text2: Mi ngi mel ni doomu fuddën gu nit jël , ji ko ci toolam . Mu sax , nekk garab , ba picci asamaan ñëw , tàgg ciy caram . »

text: And again he said , Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God ?
text2: Mu neeti : « Lan laa man a mengaleek nguuru Yàlla ?

text: It is like leaven , which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Mi ngi mel ni lawiir bu jigéen jël , jaxase ko ak ñetti andaari fariñ , ba kera tooyal bépp di funki . »

text: And he went through the cities and villages , teaching , and journeying toward Jerusalem .
text2: Yeesoo ngi doon jaar ci ay dëkk yu mag ak yu ndaw , di jàngale te jublu Yerusalem .

text: Then said one unto him , Lord , are there few that be saved ? And he said unto them ,
text2: Am ku ko ne : « Boroom bi , ndax ñiy mucc ñu néew lay doon ? » Yeesu ne leen :

text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate : for many , I say unto you , will seek to enter in , and shall not be able .
text2: « Defleen seen kem - kàttan , ngir dugg ci bunt bu xat bi , ndaxte maa ngi leen koy wax , ñu bare dinañu jéem a dugg , waaye duñu ko man .

text: When once the master of the house is risen up , and hath shut to the door , and ye begin to stand without , and to knock at the door , saying , Lord , Lord , open unto us ; and he shall answer and say unto you , I know you not whence ye are :
text2: Jamono dina ñëw , ju boroom kër gi di jóg , tëj buntam . Dingeen nekk ci biti di fëgg naan : “ Boroom bi , ubbil nu ! ” Dina leen tontu ne : “ Xawma fu ngeen bokk . ”

text: Then shall ye begin to say , We have eaten and drunk in thy presence , and thou hast taught in our streets .
text2: Bu ko defee dingeen tàmbalee naan : “ Noo doon bokk di lekk ak di naan , te jàngale nga ci sunuy pénc . ”

text: But he shall say , I tell you , I know you not whence ye are ; depart from me , all ye workers of iniquity .
text2: Waaye dina ne : “ Nee naa leen xawma fu ngeen bokk . Yéen ñépp soreleen ma , defkati lu bon yi ! ”

text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth , when ye shall see Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , and all the prophets , in the kingdom of God , and you yourselves thrust out .
text2: Foofa dingeen jooy , di yéyu , bu ngeen gisee seeni maam Ibraayma , Isaaxa , Yanqóoba ak yonent yépp ci nguuru Yàlla , te ñu dàq leen ca biti .

text: And they shall come from the east , and from the west , and from the north , and from the south , and shall sit down in the kingdom of God .
text2: Ay nit dinañu jóge penku ak sowu , nor ak sudd , ñëw , bokk lekk ci ñam , yi Yàlla di joxe ci nguuram .

text: And , behold , there are last which shall be first , and there are first which shall be last .
text2: Noonu ñenn ci ñi mujj ñooy jiituji ; te ci ñi jiitu , ñooy mujji . »

text: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees , saying unto him , Get thee out , and depart hence : for Herod will kill thee .
text2: Ca jamono jooja ay Farisen ñëw ca Yeesu ne ko : « Jógeel fii , dem feneen , ndaxte Erodd a ngi lay wut a rey . »

text: And he said unto them , Go ye , and tell that fox , Behold , I cast out devils , and I do cures to day and to morrow , and the third day I shall be perfected .
text2: Noonu mu ne leen : « Demleen ne bukki boobu ne ko : “ Xoolal , maa ngi dàq rab yi tey wéral nit ñi tey ak suba . Ca ñetteelu fan ba , ma àgg fa ma Yàlla jëmale . ”

text: Nevertheless I must walk to day , and to morrow , and the day following : for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem .
text2: Waaye fàww ma dox sama itte tey , suba ak gannaaw suba , ndaxte wareesul a reye ab yonent feneen fu dul Yerusalem .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , which killest the prophets , and stonest them that are sent unto thee ; how often would I have gathered thy children together , as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: « Yerusalem , Yerusalem , yaw miy rey yonent yi , tey sànni ay doj ndaw yi , ba ñu dee , aka maa bëggoon a dajale say doom , ni ginaar di uufe ay cuujam te nanguwuleen !

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate : and verily I say unto you , Ye shall not see me , until the time come when ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Kon nag Yàlla dina bërgël seen kër . Te maa ngi leen koy wax , dungeen ma gisati , ba kera ngeen ne : “ Yaw miy ñëw ci turu Boroom bi , ku barkeel nga ! ” »

text: And it came to pass , as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day , that they watched him .
text2: Benn bésu noflaay Yeesu dem ci këru benn kilifag Farisen yi , ngir lekke fa . Nit ñaa ngi ko doon xool bu baax .

text: And , behold , there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy .
text2: Faf am ca kanamam nit ku feebaroon , ay tànkam newi .

text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day ?
text2: Yeesu yékkati baatam , ne xutbakat ya ak Farisen ya : « Ndax jaadu na , nu faj ci bésu noflaay bi ? »

text: And they held their peace . And he took him , and healed him , and let him go ;
text2: Waaye ñépp ne cell . Yeesu daldi laal jarag ja , faj ko , ba noppi ne ko mu ñibbi .

text: And answered them , saying , Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit , and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day ?
text2: Gannaaw loolu mu ne leen : « Ku sa doom walla sa yëkk daanu ci teen , ndax doo dem génneji ko ca saa sa , fekk sax bésub noflaay la ? »

text: And they could not answer him again to these things .
text2: Amuñu woon dara lu ñu ciy teg .

text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden , when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms ; saying unto them ,
text2: Yeesu gis ni gan yi doon tànne toogu yu yiw yi , mu daldi leen wax léeb wii :

text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding , sit not down in the highest room ; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him ;
text2: « Bu ñu la wooyee ci xewu céet , bul jël toogu bu yiw . Man na am woo nañu it nit ku la ëpp daraja .

text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee , Give this man place ; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room .
text2: Kon ki leen woo yéen ñaar ñépp man na ñëw ci yaw ne la : “ Joxal toogu bi nit kii . ” Noonu dinga rus a dem ca toogu bu gannaawe ba .

text: But when thou art bidden , go and sit down in the lowest room ; that when he that bade thee cometh , he may say unto thee , Friend , go up higher : then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee .
text2: Waaye bu ñu la wooyee , demal ca toogu bu gannaawe ba . Bu ko defee ki la woo , bu agsee ne la : “ Sama xarit , àggal ca kaw . ” Loolu dina la sagal ci ñi nga toogandool ci lekkukaay bi .

text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Ndaxte képp kuy yékkatiku , dees na la suufeel , te kuy suufeelu , dinañu la yékkati . »

text: Then said he also to him that bade him , When thou makest a dinner or a supper , call not thy friends , nor thy brethren , neither thy kinsmen , nor thy rich neighbours ; lest they also bid thee again , and a recompence be made thee .
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne ki ko woo woon lekk : « Boo dee woote añ walla reer , bul woo rekk say xarit , say doomi ndey , say bokk , walla say dëkkandoo yu am alal . Lu ko moy ñooñu itam dinañu la woo , fey la bor bi .

text: But when thou makest a feast , call the poor , the maimed , the lame , the blind :
text2: Waaye boo dee woote lekk , wool néew doole yi , làggi yi , lafañ yi ak gumba yi .

text: And thou shalt be blessed ; for they cannot recompense thee : for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just .
text2: Soo ko defee , dinga barkeel , ndaxte duñu la ko man a fey , waaye dinga jot sag pey , bés bi ñi jub di dekki . »

text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things , he said unto him , Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God .
text2: Bi mu déggee wax yooyu , kenn ca gan ya ne Yeesu : « Kiy lekk ci ñam , yi Yàlla di joxe ci nguuram , barkeel nga ! »

text: Then said he unto him , A certain man made a great supper , and bade many :
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Dafa amoon nit ku togglu ay ñam , woo ay nit ñu bare .

text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden , Come ; for all things are now ready .
text2: Bi waxtuw lekk jotee mu yónni surga ca ña muy ganale , fàttali leen : “ Man ngeen a ñëw , ndaxte lépp sotti na léegi . ”

text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse . The first said unto him , I have bought a piece of ground , and I must needs go and see it : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: « Waaye ñu tàmbali di jéggalu ci ngan gi ñoom ñépp . Ku jëkk ka ne ko : “ Damaa jënd tool léegi , te fàww ma dem seeti ko . Maa ngi lay ñaan , nga jéggal ma . ”

text: And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I go to prove them : I pray thee have me excused .
text2: Keneen ne : “ Damaa jënd léegi fukki yëkk , te damay dem nii , jéem leen a beyloo ba xam . Maa ngi lay ñaan , nga jéggal ma . ”

text: And another said , I have married a wife , and therefore I cannot come .
text2: Keneen ne ko : “ Damay sog a takk jabar , looloo tax duma man a ñëw . ”

text: So that servant came , and shewed his lord these things . Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant , Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city , and bring in hither the poor , and the maimed , and the halt , and the blind .
text2: « Surga ba dellu ca njaatigeem nettali ko loolu lépp . Noonu boroom kër ga mer , daldi ne surga ba : “ Demal gaaw ca pénc ya ak ca mbedd ya ca dëkk ba , te indil ma fii néew doole yi , ñu làggi ñi , gumba yi ak lafañ yi . ”

text: And the servant said , Lord , it is done as thou hast commanded , and yet there is room .
text2: « Surga ba ñëwaat ne ko : “ Sang bi , def naa li nga ma sant , waaye bérab bi feesul . ”

text: And the lord said unto the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges , and compel them to come in , that my house may be filled .
text2: Noonu njaatige ba ne ko : “ Génnal dëkk bi te dem ca yoon ya ak ca tool ya , xiir nit ñi , ñu duggsi , ngir sama kër fees .

text: For I say unto you , That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper .
text2: Maa ngi leen koy wax , ci ñi ma woo woon ci sama reer bi , kenn du ci ñam . ” »

text: And there went great multitudes with him : and he turned , and said unto them ,
text2: Am mbooloo yu réy yu toppoon ci Yeesu , ba muy dem ca yoon wa . Mu geestu ne leen :

text: If any man come to me , and hate not his father , and mother , and wife , and children , and brethren , and sisters , yea , and his own life also , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: « Képp ku ñëw ci man te gënalu ma ko baayam , yaayam , jabaram , ay doomam , ay magam ak ay rakkam , walla sax bakkanam , du man a nekk sama taalibe .

text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross , and come after me , cannot be my disciple .
text2: Képp koo xam ne nanguwuloo ñàkk sa bakkan , ba mel ni ku ñu daaj ci bant , te nga topp ma , doo man a nekk sama taalibe .

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: Su kenn ci yéen bëggee tabax taaxum kaw , ndax du jëkk a toog , xalaat ñaata la ko war a dikke , ngir seet ba xam ndax am na xaalis bu man a àggale liggéey bi ?

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Lu ko moy , su yékkatee fondamaa bi te mënu koo àggale , ñi koy gis dinañu ko ñaawal , naan ko :

text: Saying , This man began to build , and was not able to finish .
text2: “ Waa jii dafa tàmbalee tabax , waaye mënu koo àggale . ”

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: Walla boog ban buur mooy dugg ci xare ak beneen buur te jëkkul a toog , seet ba xam moom ak fukki junniy xarekat man na xeex ak kiy ñëw ak ñaar - fukki junniy xarekat ?

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Su ko mënul , dafay yónni ndaw ca beneen buur ba , fi ak ma ngay sore , ngir ñu juboo .

text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Naka noonu itam ku nekk ci yéen , bu dëdduwul li mu am lépp , du man a nekk sama taalibe .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: « Xam ngeen nag ne , xorom lu baax la , waaye bu sàppee , nan lañu koy delloo cafkaam ?

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Du jariñ suuf , te du nekk tos . Dañu koy sànni ca biti . Déglul bu baax , yaw mi am ay nopp . »

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Ay juutikat ak ay boroom bàkkaar daan jegesi Yeesu ngir déglu ko .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: Farisen ya ak xutbakat ya di ñurumtu naan : « Waa jii mi ngi nangoo nekk ak ay boroom bàkkaar ak a lekkandook ñoom ! »

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: Noonu Yeesu daldi leen wax léeb wii ne leen :

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: « Kan ci yéen soo amoon téeméeri xar , te benn réer ci , nooy def ? Ndax doo bàyyi ca parlukaay ba juróom - ñeent - fukki xar ya ak juróom - ñeent , toppi ma réer , ba gis ko ?

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: Te boo ko gisee , dinga ko gàddu ak bànneex , yóbbu ko kër ga .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: Boo àggee ca kër ga , dinga woo say xarit ak say dëkkandoo ne leen : “ Kaayleen bànneexu ak man , ndaxte gis naa sama xar ma réeroon . ”

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: « Maa ngi leen di wax lii : ci noonule , dina am mbég ci asamaan , bu benn bàkkaarkat tuubee ay bàkkaaram . Te mbég moomu mooy ëpp mbég , mi fay am , ngir juróom - ñeent - fukk ak juróom - ñeent ñu jub , te soxlawuñoo tuub seeni bàkkaar .

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: « Te it bu jigéen dencoon fukki libidoor , benn réer ca , nu muy def ? Ndax du taal ab làmp , bale kër ga , seet fu nekk , ba gis ko ?

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: Bu ko gisee , dina woo ay xaritam ak ay dëkkandoom ne leen : “ Kaayleen bànneexu ak man , ndaxte gis naa sama alal ja réeroon . ”

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Maa ngi leen di wax lii : ci noonule la malaakay Yàlla yi di ame mbég ci benn bàkkaarkat bu tuubee ay bàkkaaram . »

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: Yeesu dellu ne leen : « Dafa amoon góor gu am ñaari doom .

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: Benn bés caat ma ne baay ba : “ Baay , damaa bëggoon , nga jox ma li may war a féetewoo ci ndono li . ” Noonu baay ba daldi leen séddale alalam .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: Ay fan yu néew gannaaw gi , caat ma fab yëfam yépp , dem ca réew mu sore , yàq fa alalam ci topp nafsoom .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: Bi mu sànkee alalam jépp , xiif bu metti dal ca réew ma , mu tàmbalee ñàkk .

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: Mu dem nag , di liggéeyal ku dëkk ca réew ma , kooku yebal ko ca ay toolam ngir mu sàmm mbaam - xuux ya .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: Mu xiif ba bëgg a lekk ca ñamu mbaam - xuux ya , ndaxte kenn mayu ko dara .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: Mujj xelam dellusi , mu ne : “ Sama baay am na ay surga yu bare , te dañuy lekk ba suur . Man nag maa ngi fii di bëgg a dee ak xiif !

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Damay jóg , dem ca sama baay ne ko : ‘ Baay , tooñ naa Yàlla , tooñ naa la ;

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: yeyootumaa nekk sa doom ; boole ma ci say surga . ’ ”

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: « Mu daldi jóg , jëm kër baayam . Waaye bi muy soreendi kër ga , baayam séen ko , yërëm ko , daldi daw laxasu ko , fóon ko .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: Doom ja ne ko : “ Baay , tooñ naa Yàlla , tooñ naa la ; yeyootumaa nekk sa doom . ”

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: Waaye baay ba ne ay surgaam : “ Gaawleen indi mbubb , mi gën a rafet , solal ko ko . Te ngeen roof ab jaaro ci loxoom te solal ko ay dàll .

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: Indileen sëllu wu duuf wa te rey ko , nu lekk te bànneexu ;

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: ndaxte sama doom jii dafa dee woon te dundaat na , dafa réeroon te feeñ na . ” Noonu ñu tàmbalee bànneexu .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: « Fekk booba taaw baa nga woon ca tool ya . Bi mu ñëwee , ba jub kër ga , mu dégg ñuy tëgg , di fecc .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: Mu daldi woo kenn ca surga ya nag , laaj ko lu xew .

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: Mu tontu ko : “ Sa rakk moo dellusi , te sa baay rey na sëllu wu duuf wa , ndaxte ñibbisi na ci jàmm . ”

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: « Ci kaw loolu taaw ba daldi mer , bañ a dugg ca kër ga . Baayam daldi génn , ngir ñaan ko mu dugg .

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: Waaye taaw ba tontu baayam ne ko : “ Seetal ñaata at laa la liggéeyal , mel ni jaam , te musumaa moy sa ndigal , waaye yaw , musuloo ma may sax tef , ngir ma bànneexu , man ak samay xarit .

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: Waaye bi sa doom jii dikkee , moom mi yàq sa alal ci ndoxaan , reyal nga ko sëllu wu duuf wi . ”

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: Noonu baay bi tontu ko ne ko : “ Sama doom , yaa ngi ak man bés bu nekk , te li ma am lépp , yaa ko moom .

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: Waaye war nanoo bànneexu te bég , ndaxte sa rakk jii dafa dee woon te dundaat na , dafa réeroon te feeñ na . ” »

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: Yeesu neeti ay taalibeem : « Benn boroom alal moo amoon bëkk - néeg bu ñu jiiñ ne , dafay pasar - pasaree alal ji .

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: Waa ja woo ko ne ko : “ Li may dégg ci yaw mooy lan ? Leeralal ma ni nga liggéeye ak sama alal , ndaxte dootoo nekkati sama bëkk - néeg . ”

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: « Bëkk - néeg bi di xalaat naan : “ Nu may def nag , segam sama njaatige dafa may dàq ci liggéey bi mu ma joxoon ? Dem beyi ? Awma kàttanam . Yelwaani ? Rus naa ko .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Xam naa ni may def , ba su ma ñàkkee sama liggéey , ay nit fat ma . ”

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: Noonu mu daldi woolu kenn ku nekk ca ña ameeloon njaatigeem bor . Ka jëkk a ñëw , mu ne ko : “ Ñaata nga ameel sama njaatige ? ”

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: Mu ne ko : “ Téeméeri bidoŋi diwlinu oliw . ” Bëkk - néeg ba ne ko : “ Sa kayit a ngii . Toogal fii gaaw te bind juróom - fukk . ”

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: Mu neeti keneen : “ Yaw nag , ñaata nga ko ameel ? ” Mu ne ko : “ Téeméeri saakuy pepp . ” Bëkk - néeg ba ne ko : “ Sa kayit a ngii . Bindal juróom - ñett - fukk . ”

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: Njaatige ba nag daldi naw ni bëkk - néeg bu njublaŋ boobu muuse woon . Ndaxte ñi bokk ci àddina ñoo gën a muus ci li ñu jote ci seen diggante ak seen moroom , ba raw ñi bokk ci leeru Yàlla . »

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: Yeesu teg ca ne : « Maa ngi leen di wax lii : sàkkuleen ay xarit jaare ko ci alalu àddina , ngir bu alal nekkatul , ñu man leen a fat ca dal yu sax ya .

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: Nit ku maandu ci yëf yu néew , dina maandu itam ci yu bare . Ku jubadi ci yëf yu néew , du jub ci yu bare .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Su fekkeente ne nag jubuleen ci alalu àddina , kon ku leen di dénk alal ju wóor ji ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: Te su ngeen maanduwul ci alal ji ngeen moomul , kon ku leen di jox alal ji ngeen moom ?

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: « Benn jaam mënul a jaamoondoo ñaari sang ; fàww nga bañ kii , bëgg ki ci des , walla nga jàpp ci kenn ki , xeeb ki ci des . Mënuleen a boole jaamu Yàlla ak jaamu Alal . »

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: Farisen yi déglu li Yeesu doon wax lépp , tàmbali di ko reetaan , ndaxte ñu bëggoon xaalis lañu .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: Waaye Yeesu ne leen : « Yéen yéena ngi fexee jub ci kanamu nit ñi waaye Yàlla xam na seen xol . Ndaxte li nit ñiy fonk , Yàlla sib na ko .

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: « Yoonu Musaa wi ak waxi yonent yi ñu ngi fi woon ba kera Yaxya di ñëw . La ko dale foofa nag , yégle nañu xebaar bu baax bi ci nguuru Yàlla , te ñépp a ngi góor - góorlu , ngir dugg ci .

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: Waaye nag asamaan ak suuf jóge fi moo gën a yomb randal wenn rëdd ci arafu yoonu Musaa .

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: « Ku fase sa jabar , ba noppi takk keneen , njaaloo nga , te ku takk jigéen ju jëkkëram fase , njaaloo nga .

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: « Dafa amoon boroom alal juy sol yére yu rafet te jafe , tey dund bés bu set dund gu neex .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: Fekk miskin mu ñuy wax Lasaar daan tëdd ca buntu këram , fees dell ak ay góom ,

text: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man ' s table : moreover the dogs came and licked his sores .
text2: te bu sañoon , di lekk ci desiti ñam wiy rot ci lekkukaayu boroom alal ji . Xaj yi sax daan nañu ñëw , di mar ay góomam .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: « Noonu miskin ma dee , malaaka yi yóbbu ko ca wetu Ibraayma . Boroom alal ja itam dee , ñu suul ko .

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: Bi ñu koy mbugal ca safara , mu téen , séen fu sore Ibraayma ak Lasaar ci wetam .

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: Noonu mu yuuxu ne : “ Maam Ibraayma , yërëm ma ! Yebalal Lasaar , mu sëpp catul baaraamam ci ndox , seralal ma sama làmmiñ , ndaxte maa ngi sonn lool ci safara sii ! ”

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: Ibraayma ne ko : “ Sama doom , fàttalikul ne , jot nga sa bànneex ci àddina , fekk Lasaar dëkk ci tiis . Looloo tax xolam sedd fii , yaw nag , ngay sonn .

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: Rax - ca - dolli it am na kàmb gu xóot sunu diggante ak yéen , ba tax ñi bëgg a jóge fii jëm ci yéen , walla ñi bëgg a jóge foofu jëmsi ci nun , duñu ko man . ”

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: « Noonu boroom alal ja ne : “ Kon nag maam , maa ngi lay ñaan , nga yebal Lasaar ca sama kër baay ,

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: ndaxte am naa fa juróomi rakk . Na leen artu , ngir ñu bañ a ñëw ñoom itam ci bérabu metit wii . ”

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: Ibraayma ne ko : “ Say doomu baay , ñu ngeek yoonu Musaa ak téerey yonent yi . Nañu leen déggal . ”

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: Boroom alal ja ne ko : “ Déedéet , maam Ibraayma , waaye su kenn dekkee , dem ca ñoom , dinañu tuub seeni bàkkaar . ”

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: Waaye Ibraayma tontu ko ne : “ Su ñu dégluwul Musaa ak yonent yi , kon ku dekki sax , du tax ñu gëm . ” »

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Yeesu waxaat ay taalibeem ne leen : « Fiir yuy yóbbe nit bàkkaar mënta ñàkk , waaye toroxte dal na ki koy lal .

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Ñu takk doj wu réy ci baatam , sànni ko ci géej moo gën ci moom muy daaneel ci bàkkaar kenn ci ñi gën a tuuti ci ñii .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: Wottuleen seen bopp . « Bu sa mbokk tooñee , yedd ko . Bu réccoo , baal ko .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: Te su la tooñee juróom - ñaari yoon ci bés bi , te ñëw ci yaw juróom - ñaari yoon ne la : “ Tuub naa ko , ” nanga ko baal . »

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Ndaw ya wax Boroom bi ne ko : « Yokkal sunu ngëm . »

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Boroom bi tontu ne : « Su ngeen amee ngëm gu tuuti sax niw peppu fuddën , kon dingeen man a ne garab gii : “ Buddeekul , dem jëmbëtu ca géej ga , ” te dina def li ngeen wax .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: « Kan ci yéen bu amoon surga bu beyi walla bu sàmmi ba ñëw , ndax dafa ko naa : “ Kaay lekk . ”

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: Déedéet . Xanaa kay da ko naan : “ Defaral ma réer bi . Takkul te tibbal ma , ba ma lekk te naan , ba noppi nga door a lekk te naan . ”

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: Li surga ba topp ndigal , ndax tax na mu yelloo ngërëm ? Déedéet .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Noonu yéen itam bu ngeen toppee li ñu leen sant lépp ba noppi , dangeen a war ne : “ Ay surga rekk lanu . Sunu warugar lanu def . ” »

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Bi muy dem Yerusalem ba tey , Yeesu jaar ci dig wiy xaajale Samari ak Galile .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: Bi muy jub benn dëkk , fukki gaana ñëw , dogale ko . Ñu taxaw dand ko , di wax ca kaw naan :

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: « Yeesu , kilifa gi , yërëm nu ! »

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Naka la leen Yeesu di gis , naan leen : « Demleen won seen bopp saraxalekat ya . » Bi ñuy dem , ñu daldi set .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Kenn ci ñoom gis ne wér na , daldi dëpp , di màggal Yàlla ak baat bu xumb .

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: Mu dëpp jëwam ca tànki Yeesu , di ko gërëm . Fekk nitu Samari la woon .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Noonu Yeesu daldi ne : « Xanaa du fukk yépp a wér ? Ana juróom - ñeent ña nag ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: Amul kenn ci ñoom ku ñëw gërëm Yàlla ku dul doxandéem bii ! »

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne ko : « Jógal dem ; sa ngëm faj na la . »

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Farisen yi laaj Yeesu ne ko : « Kañ la Yàlla di tëral nguuram ? » Mu tontu leen ne : « Bu Yàlla di wàcce nguuram ci nit ñi , kenn du ko man a teg bët .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Duñu man a wax it ne : “ Xool - leen , mi ngi fii , ” walla : “ Ma nga fale , ” ndaxte nguuru Yàlla wàcc na ci seen biir . »

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Noonu mu ne taalibe ya : « Jamono dina ñëw , fu ngeen di bëgg a gis su doon sax benn fan ci jamono ju Doomu nit ki di ñëw , waaye dungeen ko gis .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Dees na leen ne : “ Mi ngi fii ! ” walla : “ Ma nga fale ! ” Buleen dem , mbaa ngeen di leen topp .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Ndaxte ni melax naan ràyye ci asamaan , di leeral gii wet , ba ca gee , noonu it la Doomu nit ki di mel ci bésam .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Waaye balaa booba fàww mu sonn lool te niti jamono jii dëddu ko .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: « La xewoon ca bési Nóoyin , dina xewaat ci bési Doomu nit ki .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Nit ñaa ngi doon lekk ak di naan , di jël jabar ak a séyi , ba bés ba Nóoyin duggee ca gaal ga . Noonu mbënn ma ñëw , rey leen ñoom ñépp .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: « Dina mel it ni la xewoon ca bési Lóot . Nit ñaa ngi doon lekk ak di naan , di jënd ak di jaay , di ji ak di tabax .

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: Waaye bés ba Lóot génnee Sodom , Yàlla tawloo safara ak tamarax , rey leen ñoom ñépp .

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: Noonu lay mel , bés bu Doomu nit kiy feeñ .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: « Ca bés boobee ku nekk ca kaw kër ga te ay bagaasam nekk ca biir , bumu wàcc jëli leen . Te it ku nekk ca tool ya , bu mu ñibbi .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Fàttalikuleen jabaru Lóot !

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Kuy wut a rawale sa bakkan , dinga ko ñàkk , waaye ku ko ñàkk , dinga dund .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: Maa ngi leen koy wax : ca jamono jooju , ñaar dinañu bokk a tëdd guddi , dees na yóbbu kenn ki , bàyyi ka ca des .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Ñaari jigéen dinañu wolandoo , dees na yóbbu kenn ci , bàyyi ka ca des . »

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Taalibe yi ne Yeesu : « Fu loolu di xewe , Boroom bi ? » Yeesu tontu leen ne : « Fa médd nekk , la tan yiy dajee . »

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Noonu Yeesu wax leen itam léeb wii ngir xamal leen ne , war nañoo sax ci ñaan te bañ a xàddi .

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: Nee na : « Dafa amoon cib dëkk , benn àttekat bu ragalul Yàlla te faalewul mbindeef .

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: Amoon na itam ca dëkk ba jigéen ju jëkkëram faatu ju daan faral di ñëw ci moom , naan ko : “ Àtte ma ak sama noon ! ”

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: Àttekat ba bañ lu yàgg , waaye am bés mu ne ci xelam : “ Ragaluma Yàlla te faalewuma mbindeef ,

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: waaye jigéen jii lakkal na ma ; kon dinaa ko àtte , ngir mu bañatee ñëw sonal ma . Dina rey ak ay wax . ” »

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Boroom bi tegaat ca ne : « Dégluleen bu baax li àttekat bu bon boobu wax ;

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: ndax Yàlla du àtte jub mbooloom mi mu tànn te ñu koy ñaan wall guddi ak bëccëg ? Ndax dina leen xaarloo ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Maa ngi leen koy wax , dina leen àtte jub ci lu gaaw . Waaye bu Doomu nit ki ñëwee , ndax dina fekk ngëm ci àddina ? »

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: Yeesu waxaat léeb wii nit , ñi foog ne jub nañu tey xeeb ñi ci des .

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: Mu ne : « Dafa amoon ñaari nit ñu dem ca kër Yàlla ga , di ñaan . Kenn ki ab Farisen la , ki ci des juutikat .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Farisen baa nga taxaw di ñaan ci xelam naan : “ Yaw Yàlla , maa ngi lay sant ci li ma melul ni ñeneen ñiy sàcc , di def lu jubadi te di njaaloo , rawatina juutikat bii .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Ayu - bés gu nekk damay woor ñaari yoon , di joxe asaka ci lépp lu ma wut . ”

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: « Juutikat ba moom , ma nga taxaw fu sore te bëggul a siggi sax , xool ca asamaan . Waaye ma ngay fëgg dënnam te naan : “ Yaw Yàlla , yërëm ma , man miy bàkkaarkat . ” »

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Yeesu teg ca ne : « Maa ngi leen koy wax , nit kooku , ba muy ñibbi këram , moom la Yàlla àtte ni ku jub , waaye du Farisen ba . Ndaxte képp kuy yékkatiku dees na la suufeel , te kuy suufeelu , ñu yékkati la . »

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Amoon na ay nit , ñuy indil Yeesu ay liir , ngir mu teg leen ay loxoom . Bi taalibe ya gisee loolu , ñu gëdd leen .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Waaye Yeesu woo leen ne : « Bàyyileen xale yi , ñu ñëw ci man , te buleen leen tere , ndaxte ñu mel ni ñoom ñoo yelloo nguuru Yàlla .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Ci dëgg , maa ngi leen koy wax , woyoful ni xale , nangu nguuru Yàlla , doo ci man a dugg . »

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Benn njiitu Yawut laaj Yeesu ne ko : « Kilifa gu baax gi , lu ma war a def , ba am wàll ci dund gu dul jeex ? »

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Yeesu tontu ko : « Lu tax nga wooye ma ku baax ? Yàlla rekk a baax .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Xam nga ndigal yi : “ Bul njaaloo , bul bóom , bul sàcc , bul seede lu dul dëgg , teralal sa ndey ak sa baay . ” »

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Njiit la ne ko : « Loolu lépp sàmm naa ko li dale ci sama ndaw ba tey . »

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Bi Yeesu déggee loolu , mu ne ko : « Lenn rekk moo la dese . Jaayal li nga am lépp , séddale ko miskin yi te dinga woomle ca asamaan ; boo noppee , nga ñëw topp ci man . »

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: Bi nit ka déggee loolu , mu am tiis , ndaxte ku bare woon alal la .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Yeesu xool ko , daldi ne : « Boroom alal , dugg ci nguuru Yàlla , lu jafee ngoogu !

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Giléem jaar ci bën - bënu pusa moo gën a yomb boroom alal dugg ci nguuru Yàlla . »

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Ñi doon déglu daldi ne : « Kon nag ku man a mucc ? »

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: Yeesu tontu ne : « Li të nit ñi , tëwul Yàlla . »

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Noonu Piyeer ne : « Nun de , dëddu nanu li nu am lépp , topp la . »

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: Yeesu ne leen : « Ci dëgg maa ngi leen koy wax , képp ku dëddu kër walla jabar walla ay doomi ndey walla ay waajur walla ay doom ngir nguuru Yàlla ,

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: dinga am tey jii ay yooni yoon , ak dund gu dul jeex ëllëg . »

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Yeesu wéetoo ak fukki taalibe yi ak ñaar ne leen : « Nu ngi dem Yerusalem , te li yonent yi bindoon lépp ci mbirum Doomu nit ki dina mat .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Dinañu ko jébbal ñi dul Yawut , ñu ñaawal ko , saaga ko , tifli ci kawam .

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Gannaaw bu ñu ko dóoree ay yar ba noppi , dinañu ko rey , waaye ca ñetteelu fan ba dina dekki . »

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: Waaye taalibe ya dégguñu li mu leen doon wax ; kàddu yooyu ump na leen , te xamuñu li waxi Yeesu yooyu tekki .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Bi Yeesu di agsi dëkku Yeriko , am gumba gu toogoon ca wetu yoon wa , di yelwaan .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: Naka la gumba ga dégg mbooloo di jàll , mu laaj lan moo xew .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Ñu wax ko ne : « Yeesum Nasaret moo fay jaar . »

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Noonu mu yuuxu ne : « Yeesu , Sëtu Daawuda , yërëm ma ! »

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Ñi jiitu woon gëdd ko , ngir mu noppi . Waaye muy gën a yuuxu naan : « Sëtu Daawuda , yërëm ma ! »

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Noonu Yeesu taxaw , santaane ñu indil ko ko . Bi mu jegesee , Yeesu laaj ko ne :

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: « Loo bëggoon ma defal la ko ? » Mu ne ko : « Sang bi , damaa bëgg a gis . »

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne ko : « Na say bët gis ! Sa ngëm faj na la . »

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Ca saa sa mu daldi gis . Noonu mu topp ci Yeesu , di màggal Yàlla . Mbooloo mépp gis loolu , di sant Yàlla .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Yeesu dugg na Yeriko , jaar ca dëkk ba , di dem .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Waaye amoon na fa waa ju ñuy wax Sase . Njiitu juutikat la , te di ku bare alal .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Bëgg na gis kan mooy Yeesu , waaye dafa gàtt lool , ba mënu koo gis ndax mbooloo ma .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Noonu mu daw , jiituji ca yoon wa , yéeg ci genn garab ngir gis Yeesu , ndaxte foofa la naroon a jaar .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Bi Yeesu dikkee ba tollook garab ga nag , mu téen ne ko : « Sase , wàccal gaaw , ndax tey sa kër laa war a dal . »

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Sase daldi gaawantu wàcc , ganale ko ak mbég .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Ñépp gis loolu , di ñurum - ñurumi naan : « Mi ngi dal cig këru boroom bàkkaar . »

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: Waaye Sase taxaw ne Boroom bi : « Déglul Boroom bi , dogu naa may sama genn - wàllu alal miskin yi , te lu ma mas a njublaŋ nit , jël alalam , dinaa ko fey ñeenti yoon lu ni tollu . »

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Yeesu ne ko : « Mucc gi wàcc na tey ci kër gii , ndaxte nit kii , ci askanu Ibraayma la bokk itam .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Ndaxte Doomu nit ki ñëw na , ngir seet te musal ñi réer . »

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Bi nit ñi doon déglu kàddu yooyu , Yeesu teg ca léeb , ndaxte jege woon na Yerusalem , te ñoom foogoon nañu ne , nguuru Yàlla dafay daldi feeñ ca saa sa .

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Mu ne nag : « Dafa amoon boroom juddu bu rafet bu demoon ci réew mu sore , ngir ñu fal ko buur te mu dellusiwaat .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: Noonu mu woo fukk ci ay surgaam , jox ku nekk benn libidoor , ne leen : “ Liggéeyleen ci , ba may ñibbisi . ”

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: Waaye waa réewam bëgguñu ko . Noonu ñu yónni ndaw ci gannaawam ne : “ Bëggunu nit kii yilif nu . ”

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: « Bi ñu ko falee buur nag , ba mu dellusi , mu woolu surga , ya mu joxoon wurus wa , ngir xam nan lañu ci liggéeye .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: Ku jëkk ka ñëw ne ko : “ Sang bi , sa libidoor bii jur na fukki libidoor . ”

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: Buur ba ne ko : “ Def nga lu baax , surga bu baax nga . Segam wone nga ne , takku nga ci lu tuuti , falul ci fukki dëkk . ”

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: Surga ba ca topp ñëw ne : “ Sang bi , sa libidoor ba indi na juróomi libidoor . ”

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: Buur ba ne ko : “ Yaw , falul ci juróomi dëkk . ”

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: Keneen ñëw ne : “ Sang bi , sa libidoor baa ngi nii . Dama koo fasoon ci sekkit , denc ko .

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: Dama laa ragaloon , ndaxte ku néeg nga . Dangay nangu loo dénkaanewul , di dajale loo jiwul . ”

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: Buur ba ne ko : “ Ci say wax laa lay àtte , surga bu bon bi ! Xamoon nga ne , nit ku néeg laa , di nangu lu ma dénkaanewul , te dajale lu ma jiwul .

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: Lu tax nag yóbbuwoo sama xaalis ca denckati xaalis ya ? Bés bu ma ñëwee nag , ma man a jot sama xaalis ak la mu jur . ”

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: « Ci kaw loolu mu ne ña taxawoon ca wetam : “ Nanguleen libidoor bi ci moom , jox ko boroom fukki libidoor yi . ”

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: Ñu ne ko : “ Sang bi , am na fukki libidoor ba noppi . ”

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: Buur ba ne leen : “ Maa ngi leen koy wax , ku am , dinañu la dolli , waaye ku amul , li nga am as néew sax , dinañu ko nangu .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Waaye sama noon yi , ñi bëggul woon ma doon seen buur , indileen fii , rey leen ci sama kanam . ” »

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Bi mu waxee loolu ba noppi , Yeesu dafa daldi jiitu , jëm Yerusalem .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Bi muy jege dëkki Betfase ak Betani , ci wetu tund wu ñuy wax tundu Oliw ya , Yeesu yebal ñaar ci ay taalibeem ,

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: ne leen : « Demleen ci dëkk bi ci kanam . Bu ngeen fa duggee , dingeen fa gis cumbur gu kenn musul a war . Yiwileen ko , indi .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: Bu leen kenn laajee : “ Lu tax ngeen koy yiwi ? ” tontuleen ko : “ Boroom bi da koo soxla . ” »

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: Ñaari ndaw ya dem , fekk mbir ya deme , na leen ko Yeesu waxe woon .

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: Bi ñuy yiwi cumbur ga nag , ay boroomam ne leen : « Lu tax ngeen di yiwi cumbur gi ? »

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: Ñu tontu ne : « Ndaxte Boroom bi da koo soxla . »

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: Noonu ñu indil cumbur gi Yeesu , daldi lal seeni yére ca kaw , yéegal ca Yeesu .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: Bi muy dem , nit ñi di lalal Yeesu seeni yére ci yoon wi .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: Bi ñu agsee fa mbartalum tundu Oliw ya doore , taalibeem yépp fees ak mbég , tàmbalee màggal Yàlla ca kaw ndax kéemaan yu bare yi ñu gis .

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: Ñu ngi naan : « Yaw buur biy ñëw ci turu Boroom bi , ku barkeel nga ! Na jàmm am ca asamaan , te ndam li féete ca bérab yu gën a kawe ! »

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: Waaye ay Farisen yu nekkoon ca mbooloo ma ne Yeesu : « Kilifa gi , yeddal sa taalibe yi ! »

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: Noonu mu tontu ne : « Maa ngi leen koy wax , bu ñu noppee ñoom , doj yiy xaacu . »

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: Bi Yeesu jegee dëkk ba , ba séen ko , mu jooy ko

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: naan : « Céy yaw itam , boo xamoon bésub tey yi la man a indil jàmm ! Waaye fi mu ne mënuloo koo gis .

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Bés dina ñëwi yu say noon di jal , wërale la . Dinañu la tëj ci biir , tanc la .

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: Dinañu la yàqaate , yaw ak sa waa dëkk . Doj dootul des ci kaw doj ci yaw , ndaxte ràññeewoo jamono ji Yàlla ñëwe , wallusi la . »

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: Gannaaw loolu Yeesu dugg ca kër Yàlla ga , daldi dàq ña fay jaay ,

text: Saying unto them , It is written , My house is the house of prayer : but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: naan leen : « Mbind mi nee na : “ Sama kër këru ñaan ci Yàlla lay doon ; waaye yéen def ngeen ko këru sàcc . ” »

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: Bés bu nekk Yeesu di jàngale ca kër Yàlla ga . Saraxalekat yu mag ya ak xutbakat ya , ñoom ak njiiti xeet wa , ñu ngi ko doon wut a reylu .

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: Waaye xamuñu woon lan lañu man a def , ndaxte nit ñépp a ngi ko doon déglu , bañ benn baat raw leen .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: Benn bés Yeesu doon jàngal nit ña ca kër Yàlla ga , di leen yégal xebaar bu baax bi . Saraxalekat yu mag ya ak xutbakat ya ak njiit ya ñëw ne ko :

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: « Wax nu ci ban sañ - sañ ngay defe yëf yii , walla kan moo la may boobu sañ - sañ . »

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: Yeesu tontu leen ne : « Man itam dinaa leen laaj lenn : wax leen ma ,

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: la Yaxya daan def , di sóob nit ñi ci ndox , fu mu ko jële , ci Yàlla walla ci nit ñi ? »

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: Ñu waxtaan ci seen biir naan : « Bu nu nee : “ Ci Yàlla , ” dina laaj : “ Lu tax gëmuleen ko kon ? ”

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: Te bu nu nee : “ Ci nit ñi , ” mbooloo mépp dinañu nu sànni ay xeer , ndaxte gëm nañu ne Yaxya yonent la woon . »

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: Noonu ñu tontu ne , xamuñu fu mu ko jële .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Yeesu ne leen : « Kon man itam duma leen wax ci ban sañ - sañ laay defe yëf yii . »

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: Noonu Yeesu daldi wax nit ña léeb wii : « Amoon na nit ku jëmbët toolu réseñ , batale ko ay beykat , dem tukki tukki bu yàgg .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Bi tool bi ñoree nag , mu yónni surga ci ñoom , ngir jot wàllam ci meññeef gi . Waaye beykat yi dóor ko ay yar , dàq ko , mu dellu ak loxoy neen .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: Mu yónniwaat beneen surga , ñu dóor ko moom itam , toroxal ko , dàq ko , mu dellu ak loxoy neen .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: Mu yónneeti ñetteelu surga , ñu gaañ ko , dàq ko .

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: « Boroom tool ba daldi ne : “ Nan laay def nag ? Dinaa yónni sama doom , sama reeni xol . Xëy na ñu weg ko , moom . ”

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: Waaye bi beykat yi gisee doom ji , ñu ne ci seen biir : “ Kii moo war a donn tool bi ; nan ko rey , moom ndono li . ”

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Ñu génne ko tool bi nag , rey ko . » Noonu Yeesu laaj leen : « Nu leen boroom tool bi di def , nag ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Xanaa ñëw , rey beykat yooyu , dénk tool ba ñeneen . » Bi Yeesu waxee loolu , nit ña ne ko : « Yàlla tere ! »

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Waaye Yeesu ne leen jàkk , daldi ne : « Kon nag lu baat yii ci Mbind mi di tekki : “ Doj wa tabaxkat ya sànni , mujj na di doju koñ . ”

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Képp ku dal ci doj woowu , dammtoo , te ku mu dal ci sa kaw , rajaxe la . »
