text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Xutbakat ya ak saraxalekat yu mag ya ñu ngi doon wut a jàpp Yeesu ca taxawaay ba , ndaxte xam nañu ne , ñoo tax mu wax léeb woowu . Waaye ragal nañu mbooloo ma .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: Noonu ñu koy yeeru , daldi yónni ay nit ñu mbubboo njub , sas leen ñu fexe koo jàpp ci ay waxam , ngir jébbal ko boroom réew , ma yor kilifteef ak sañ - sañ .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: Ñu daldi ñëw ci Yeesu ne ko : « Kilifa gi , xam nanu ne li ngay wax te di ko jàngale lu jub la . Amuloo parlàqu , waaye dangay xamle yoonu Yàlla ci bu wóor .

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Wax nu , ndax jaadu na , nu fey buur bi Sesaar galag walla déet . »

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Waaye Yeesu xam na seen pexe ne leen :

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: « Wonleen ma posetu denariyon . Kan lañu ci def nataalam ak turam ? » Ñu tontu ko : « Sesaar . »

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Noonu mu ne leen : « Joxleen nag Sesaar li Sesaar moom , te jox Yàlla li Yàlla moom . »

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Noonu mënuñu ko woon a jàpp ciy waxam ci kanamu mbooloo ma ; ñu waaru ci tontoom , ba wedam .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Noonu ay nit , ñu bokk ci Sadusen yi , ñëw ci moom . Sadusen yi nag ñoom weddi nañu ndekkite li . Noonu ñu laaj ko ne :

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: « Kilifa gi , Musaa bindal na nu ne , ku magam faatu te bàyyiwul doom ak jabaram , kooku war na donn jigéen ji , ba yékkati giiru magam .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Amoon na fi nag juróom - ñaari góor ñu bokk ndey ak baay . Taaw ba takk jabar , faatu , te bàyyiwul doom .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Ñaareel ba takk jigéen ja , def noonu ; ak ñetteel ba , ba juróom - ñaar ñépp faatu te bàyyiwuñu doom .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Gannaaw ga nag jigéen ja it faatu .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Ci ndekkite li nag , kan ci ñoom moo war a donn jigéen ja , fekk ku nekk ci juróom - ñaar ñi mas na koo takk ? »

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Yeesu tontu leen ne : « Ci àddina sii , góor ñi ak jigéen ñi dañuy séy .

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: Waaye ña ñu àtte ne , yeyoo nañoo bokk ci dundu ëllëg ak ci ndekkite li , kenn du am jabar , kenn du am jëkkër .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Dafa fekk ne mënatuñoo dee , ndaxte dañuy mel ni malaaka yi . Ay doomi Yàlla lañu ndaxte doomi ndekkite lañu .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Te Musaa sax wone na ne , néew yi dinañu dekki , ci saarum ngarab si . Foofa Musaa wooye na fa Boroom bi : “ Yàllay Ibraayma , Yàllay Isaaxa , di Yàllay Yanqóoba . ”

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Kon nag nekkul Yàllay ñi dee waaye Yàllay ñiy dund la , ndaxte Yàllaa tax ñépp di dund . »

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Ci kaw loolu ay xutbakat ne ko : « Li nga wax dëgg la , kilifa gi ! »

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Ndaxte kenn ci ñoom ñemeetu koo laaj dara .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne leen : « Lu tax nit ñi di wax ne , Almasi bi mooy sëtu Daawuda ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Ndaxte Daawuda moom ci boppam moo ne ci Sabóor : “ Boroom bi nee na sama Boroom : ‘ Toogal ci sama ndeyjoor ,

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: ba kera may daaneelsay noon ci sa kanam . ’ ”

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Gannaaw Daawuda nag wooye na ko “ Boroom bi , ” nu muy nekke sëtam ? »

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Bi ko nit ña fa nekkoon ñépp doon déglu , Yeesu ne ay taalibeem :

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: « Moytuleen xutbakat yi ; dañoo bëgg di doxantu , sol ay mbubb yu réy , te ñépp di leen nuyoo ñaari loxo ci pénc mi . Ci jàngu yi , toogu yu féete kanam lañuy wut , te toogu yu yiw lañuy taamu ci reeri xew yi .

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Ñu ngi lekk alalu jigéen ñi seen jëkkër faatu , di ñaan Yàlla ay ñaani ngistal yu gudd . Seen mbugal dina gën a tar . »

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Noonu Yeesu siggi , séen ay boroom alal ñuy dugal seen sarax ca ndab ya ca kër Yàlla ga .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Mu gis itam jenn jigéen ju jëkkëram faatu te mu ñàkk , ju fa def ñaari poseti xànjar .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: Noonu mu daldi ne : « Ci dëgg , maa ngi leen koy wax , jigéen ju ñàkk jee moo ëpp ñeneen ñépp lu mu joxe .

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Ñoom ñépp dañu sàkku ci seen barele , waaye moom dafa sàkku ci néewleem , ba joxe xaalis bi mu waroon a dunde . »

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Noonu ay nit doon wax ci lu jëm ca kër Yàlla ga , ak ni ñu ko rafetale ak ay doj yu jafe ak alal ju ñu jébbal Yàlla . Waaye Yeesu ne leen :

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: « Li ngeen gis fii lépp , jamono dina ñëw joo xam ne dina daanu , ba doj dootul des ci kaw doj . »

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Ñu laaj ko ne : « Kilifa gi , kañ la loolu di am ? Te luy tegtal ne , looloo ngi waaj a xew ? »

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Yeesu tontu ne : « Moytuleen , bu leen kenn nax . Ndaxte ñu bare dinañu ñëw ci sama tur ne : “ Moom laa , ” walla ñu naan : “ Jamono ji jegesi na . ” Buleen topp ñooñu .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Bu ngeen déggee ay xare ak ay réew yu jóg , wottuleen a tiit , ndaxte fàww yooyule jëkk a am . Waaye taxul mujug jamono daldi taxaw . »

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Noonu mu teg ca ne : « Xeet dina jóg , xeex ak weneen xeet , réew dina xeex ak meneen réew .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Suuf dina yengu yengu yu réy , te wopp ak xiif dina am ci bérab yu bare . Dina am it ay xew - xew yu raglu ak ay firnde yu mag yuy jóge asamaan .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: Waaye bala looloo xew , dees na leen jàpp , fitnaal leen , di leen jébbal àttekat yi ca jàngu ya , tëj leen kaso . Dees na leen yóbbu ci kanam ay buur yi ak ay boroom réew ndax sama tur .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Loolu dina leen ubbil bunt , ba ngeen man maa seedeel .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Fasleen yéenee bañ a wut lay ngir musal seen bopp .

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Ndaxte man ci sama bopp maa leen di jox kàddu ak xel moo xam ne seeni noon duñu ko man a teggi , mbaa ñu di ko weddi .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Seeni waajur sax ak seeni doomi ndey , seeni bokk ak seeni xarit , dinañu leen jébbal àttekat yi , ba ñu rey ñenn ci yéen .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Te ñépp dinañu leen bañ ndax sama tur .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Waaye seen genn kawar sax du neen .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Seen muñ moo leen di musal .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: « Bu ngeen gisee ay xarekat wër dëkku Yerusalem , xamleen ne jamono , ji ñu koy yàq , agsi na .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Kon nag ku nekk ci biir diiwaanu Yude , nanga daw ca tund ya ; ku nekk ci biir dëkk bi , nanga ko génn ; te ku nekk ca tool ya , bul dugg ca dëkk ba !

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Ndaxte ci bés yooyu Yàlla dina fey jëf yi , te li ñu bindoon ci téereb Yàlla dina mat .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Ngalla jigéen ñi ëmb ca bés yooya , ngalla it ñiy nàmpal ! Ndaxte tiis wu metti dina am ci réew mi , te Yàlla dina wàcce meram ci waa réew mii .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Dees na leen reye ak i jaasi , jàpp leen jaam , yóbbu leen ci réewi àddina sépp . Te ñi dul Yawut dinañu nappaaje Yerusalem , ba kera jamonoy ñi dul Yawut mat .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: « Ay firnde dinañu feeñ ci jant bi , ci weer wi ak ci biddiiw yi . Ci kaw suuf xeet yi dinañu tiit , jaaxle ndax riiru géej gi ak yengu - yengub duus yi .

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Bu boobaa nit ñiy xëm ndax tiitaange , bu ñuy xalaat musiba , yi nar a wàcc ci àddina , ndaxte dees na yengal kàttani asamaan .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Noonu dinañu gis Doomu nit ki di ñëw ciw niir , ànd ak kàttan ak ndam lu réy .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Bu mbir yooyu di tàmbalee xew nag , boo yaboo ngeen siggi , téen , ndaxte seen njot jubsi na . »

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Noonu Yeesu misaal leen lii : « Xool - leen garabu figg ak yeneen garab yi .

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Bu ñu gisee ñu sëq , soxlawuleen kenn wax leen ne , nawet bi jubsi na xaat .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Noonu itam bu ngeen gisee loolu lépp xew , xamleen ne nguuru Yàlla jege na .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: « Ci dëgg maa ngi leen koy wax , niti jamono jii duñu wéy , te loolu lépp amul .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Asamaan ak suuf dinañu wéy , waaye samay wax du wéy mukk .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: « Moytuleen seen nafsu diigal leen ci yàqute ak ci màndite ak ittey àddina , ba bés boobu bett leen ni mbaal .

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: Ndaxte dina dal ci ñépp ñi nekk ci kaw suuf .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Yeewuleen , di sax ci ñaan , ngir ngeen man a mucc ci loolu lépp war a xew , te man a taxaw ak kóolute ci kanamu Doomu nit ki . »

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Yeesoo ngi daan yendoo jàngale ca kër Yàlla ga , te bu guddee mu dem ca tund wu ñuy wax tundu Oliw ya , fanaan fa .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Te nit ñépp dañu daan teel a xëy ca kër Yàlla ga , di ko déglu .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Màggalu Mburu ya amul lawiir jege woon na , te ñu di ko wax Bésu Jéggi ba .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Saraxalekat yu mag ya ak xutbakat ya di wut pexem reylu Yeesu , ndaxte dañoo ragaloon nit ña .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Noonu Seytaane daldi solu Yudaa , mi ñuy wooye Iskariyo te mu bokkoon ca fukki taalibe ya ak ñaar .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Noonu Yudaa dem waxtaani ak saraxalekat yu mag ya ak kilifay wottukati kër Yàlla ga , ba xam nan la leen di jébbale Yeesu .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Ñu am ca bànneex bu réy , dig ko xaalis .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: Yudaa nangu , di fexe jamono ju mu leen man a jébbal Yeesu , fu mbooloo ma nekkul .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Bésu màggalu Mburu ya amul lawiir agsi , ca bés boobu lañu waroon a rendi mbotem màggalu Jéggi ba .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: Noonu Yeesu yebal Piyeer ak Yowaana ne leen : « Demleen , defaral nu reeru Jéggi ba . »

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: Ñu ne ko : « Fan nga bëggoon , nu defare ko fa ? »

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: Mu ne leen : « Bu ngeen duggee ca dëkk ba , góor gu yenu njaq lu def ndox , dina taseek yéen . Toppleen ci moom ba ca kër ga muy dugg ,

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: te ngeen ne boroom kër ga : “ Kilifa gi nee na : Ana néegu gan , bi may lekke reeru Jéggi ba , man ak samay taalibe ? ”

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: Noonu dina leen won néeg bu féete kaw , te yaa , ñu defar ko ba noppi . Foofa ngeen koy defare . »

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Ñu dem , gis lépp , ni leen ko Yeesu waxe woon . Noonu ñu defar reer bi .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: Bi waxtu wi jotee Yeesu toog ak ndaw yi ,

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: ne leen : « Yàkkamti woon naa lool lekk ak yéen reeru Jéggi bii , laata ñu may sonal .

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: Ndaxte maa ngi leen koy wax , dootuma ko lekk mukk , lu dul ba kera mu mat ci nguuru Yàlla . »

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: Noonu mu fab kaas , daldi sant Yàlla ne : « Jël - leen kaas bii , séddoo ko .

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: Ndaxte maa ngi leen koy wax , dootuma naan ndoxum réseñ mi , ba kera Yàlla di tëral nguuram . »

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: Gannaaw loolu mu jël mburu , sant Yàlla , damm ko , joxleen ko ne : « Lii sama yaram la , wi ma joxe ngir yéen . Defleen lii , ngir fàttaliku ma . »

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: Noonu itam bi ñu lekkee ba noppi , mu jël kaas bi ne leen : « Kaas bii mooy misaal kóllëre gu bees gi Yàlla fas jaarale ko ci sama deret , ji tuuru ngir yéen .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: Waaye nag loxob ki may wor a ngi nekk ak man ci ndab li .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: Doomu nit ki mu ngi dem , ni ñu ko dogale . Waaye ki koy wor dina torox . »

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: Noonu taalibe yi di laajante ci seen biir , kan ci ñoom mooy nar a def loolu .

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Taalibe ya it di werante , ngir xam kan ci ñoom moo gën a màgg .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: Yeesu ne leen : « Buuri xeeti àddina dañu leen di dóor yetu nguur , te kilifa yi dañuy sàkku ngërëm .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: Waaye yéen buleen def noonu . Ki gën a màgg ci yéen , na nekk ni ki gën a ndaw , te njiit mel ni surga .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: Ki toog ca lekkukaay ba , moom ak surgaam , ñoom ñaar kan moo ci gën a màgg ? Xanaa du ki toog ci lekkukaay bi ? Waaye man maa ngi ci seen biir ni surga .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: Yéen nag yéenay ñi ànd ak man ci samay fitna .

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: Man nag jox naa leen sañ - sañu nguuru , ni ma ko sama Baay joxe .

text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom , and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Dingeen lekkandoo te naanandoo ak man ci sama nguur . Te dingeen toog ci jal yi , di àtte fukki giir ak ñaar yu bànni Israyil . »

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: Yeesu teg ca ne : « Simoŋ , Simoŋ ! Seytaane ñaan na , ñu jébbal leen ko , ngir mu teqale leen ni ñu teqalee dugub ak xatax .

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: Waaye man ñaanal naa la , ngir sa ngëm dëgër . Te yaw , boo dellusee , nanga dëgëral sa bokki taalibe yi . »

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: Piyeer ne ko : « Boroom bi , àttan naa ànd ak yaw ca kaso , ba ci dee sax . »

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Piyeer , maa ngi la koy wax , bala ginaar a sab tey jii , dinga weddi ñetti yoon ne , xam nga ma . »

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne leen : « Ba ma leen yebalee te yóbbaalewuleen woon xaalis , mbuus , walla dàll , ndax ñàkkoon ngeen dara ? » Ñu tontu ne : « Déedéet . »

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Mu neeti leen : « Léegi nag képp ku am xaalis , na ko jël ; te ku am mbuus , na ko jël ; ku amul jaasi , na jaay mbubbam , jënde ko jaasi .

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: Ndaxte maa ngi leen koy wax , lii Mbind mi wax fàww mu am ci man , bi mu nee : “ Boole nañu ko ak ñu bon ña . ” Ndaxte loolu jëm ci man mi ngi mat . »

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
text2: Noonu taalibe ya ne ko : « Boroom bi , ñaari jaasee ngii . » Mu ne leen : « Doy na . »

text: And he came out , and went , as he was wont , to the mount of Olives ; and his disciples also followed him .
text2: Noonu Yeesu génn , dem ca tundu Oliw ya , ni mu ko daan defe nakajekk . Taalibeem ya topp ci moom .

text: And when he was at the place , he said unto them , Pray that ye enter not into temptation .
text2: Bi mu agsee ca bérab ba , mu ne leen : « Ñaanleen , ngir bañ a daanu cig fiir . »

text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone ' s cast , and kneeled down , and prayed ,
text2: Noonu mu dand leen , ba fu aw saan man a tollu , daldi sukk di ñaan ne :

text: Saying , Father , if thou be willing , remove this cup from me : nevertheless not my will , but thine , be done .
text2: « Baay , soo ko bëggee , teggil ma kaasu naqar bii . Moona bumu doon sama coobare , waaye na sa coobare am . »

text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven , strengthening him .
text2: Noonu malaakam Yàlla daldi koy feeñu , may ko doole .

text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly : and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground .
text2: Ci biir tiis , Yeesu gën a sawar ci ñaan gi , ñaqam mel ni lumbi deret dal ci suuf .

text: And when he rose up from prayer , and was come to his disciples , he found them sleeping for sorrow ,
text2: Bi mu ñaanee ba noppi , mu jóg , dellusi ci taalibe yi , fekk leen ñuy nelaw , ndaxte seen xol dafa sonnoon ak tiis .

text: And said unto them , Why sleep ye ? rise and pray , lest ye enter into temptation .
text2: Noonu mu ne leen : « Lu tax ngeen di nelaw ? Jógleen ñaan , ngir bañ a daanu cig fiir . »

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .
text2: Bi Yeesu di wax , mbooloo mu bare agsi ; ku ñuy wax Yudaa te mu bokkoon ci fukki ndaw yi ak ñaar jiite leen . Yudaa jegeñsi Yeesu , bëgg koo fóon .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Judas , betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss ?
text2: Waaye Yeesu ne ko : « Ci fóon ngay jébbale Doomu nit ki ay noonam ! »

text: When they which were about him saw what would follow , they said unto him , Lord , shall we smite with the sword ?
text2: Bi ñi àndoon ak Yeesu gisee liy bëgg a xew , ñu ne : « Boroom bi , ndax nu dóore jaasi ? »

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest , and cut off his right ear .
text2: Kenn ci ñoom nag dóor surgab saraxalekat bu mag ba , noppu ndeyjooram dagg .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Suffer ye thus far . And he touched his ear , and healed him .
text2: Waaye Yeesu daldi ne : « Bàyyileen . » Mu laal noppu waa ja , wéral ko .

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests , and captains of the temple , and the elders , which were come to him , Be ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and staves ?
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne saraxalekat yu mag ya ak kilifay wottukati kër Yàlla ga ak njiiti xeet , wa ko jàppsi woon : « Jóg ngeen , gànnaayoo jaasi ak yet , mel ni ñuy topp sàcc .

text: When I was daily with you in the temple , ye stretched forth no hands against me : but this is your hour , and the power of darkness .
text2: Moona maa nga woon ak yéen bés bu nekk ca kër Yàlla ga , te jàppuleen ma . Waaye léegi seen waxtu la , di jamonoy lëndëm . »

text: Then took they him , and led him , and brought him into the high priest ' s house . And Peter followed afar off .
text2: Ñu jàpp Yeesu , yóbbu ko ca kër saraxalekat bu mag ba . Piyeer topp fu sore .

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall , and were set down together , Peter sat down among them .
text2: Amoon na taal ca diggu ëtt ba , ay nit toog , wër ko , Piyeer itam toog ci seen biir .

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire , and earnestly looked upon him , and said , This man was also with him .
text2: Ab mbindaan gis ko , mu toog , taal bi di ko leeral , mu ne ko jàkk ne : « Nit kii itam àndoon na ak moom . »

text: And he denied him , saying , Woman , I know him not .
text2: Waaye Piyeer weddi ko ne : « Soxna si , xawma kooku . »

text: And after a little while another saw him , and said , Thou art also of them . And Peter said , Man , I am not .
text2: Nes tuuti keneen gis ko ne : « Yaw itam ci ñoom nga bokk . » Piyeer tontu ko : « Sama waay , bokkuma ci . »

text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed , saying , Of a truth this fellow also was with him : for he is a Galilaean .
text2: Bi ñu tegee lu mat waxtu , keneen dikkaat ca wax ja ne : « Ci lu wóor nit kii àndoon na ak moom , nde Galile la jóge . »

text: And Peter said , Man , I know not what thou sayest . And immediately , while he yet spake , the cock crew .
text2: Waaye Piyeer tontu ne : « Sama waay , xawma li ngay wax ! » Bi kàddoom di daanu , faf ginaar daldi sab .

text: And the Lord turned , and looked upon Peter . And Peter remembered the word of the Lord , how he had said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Noonu Boroom bi geestu , xool Piyeer . Te Piyeer fàttaliku la ko Boroom bi waxoon ne : « Bala ginaar a sab tey jii , dinga ma weddi ñetti yoon . »

text: And Peter went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Piyeer daldi génn , di jooy jooy yu metti .

text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him , and smote him .
text2: Nit ñaa nga jàppoon Yeesu , di ko ñaawal ak di ko dóor .

text: And when they had blindfolded him , they struck him on the face , and asked him , saying , Prophesy , who is it that smote thee ?
text2: Ñu ngi takkoon ay bëtam , di ko laaj , naan ko : « Yaw , wax nu ci kàddug Yàlla , ku la dóor ? »

text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him .
text2: Ñu ngi ko doon tifaar it yeneeni saaga .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,
text2: Bi bët setee , kureelu njiiti xeet wa , maanaam saraxalekat yu mag ya ak xutbakat ya , daldi daje , indi Yeesu ci seen kanam .

text: Art thou the Christ ? tell us . And he said unto them , If I tell you , ye will not believe :
text2: Ñu ne ko : « Soo dee Almasi bi , wax nu ko . » Mu tontu leen ne : « Su ma leen ko waxee , dungeen ma gëm .

text: And if I also ask you , ye will not answer me , nor let me go .
text2: Te su ma leen laajee , dungeen tontu .

text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God .
text2: Waaye gannaawsi tey , Doomu nit ki dina toog ci ndeyjooru Yàlla , Aji Kàttan ji . »

text: Then said they all , Art thou then the Son of God ? And he said unto them , Ye say that I am .
text2: Noonu ñépp ne : « Kon nag yaay Doomu Yàlla ji ? » Mu tontu leen ne : « Yéen ci seen bopp wax ngeen ne moom laa . »

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: Ñu daldi ne nag : « Lu nuy doyeeti seede léegi , ndegam nun ci sunu bopp noo ko nangoo ci gémmiñam ! »

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: Gannaaw loolu kureelu àttekat ya yépp daldi jóg , yóbbu Yeesu ca Pilaat .

text: And they began to accuse him , saying , We found this fellow perverting the nation , and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar , saying that he himself is Christ a King .
text2: Foofa ñu tàmbali di ko sosal naan : « Fekk nanu nit kii , muy fàbbi sunu réew , di leen teree fey galag Sesaar , te mi ngi teg boppam Almasi , maanaam buur . »

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .
text2: Noonu Pilaat laaj ko : « Ndax yaa di buuru Yawut yi ? » Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Wax nga ko . »

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people , I find no fault in this man .
text2: Pilaat ne saraxalekat yu mag ya ak mbooloo ma : « Gisuma genn tooñ ci nit kii . »

text: And they were the more fierce , saying , He stirreth up the people , teaching throughout all Jewry , beginning from Galilee to this place .
text2: Waaye ñu sax ci seeni wax naan : « Mi ngi jógloo mbooloo mi , di jàngale ci réewu Yawut ya mépp , li dale ci Galile ba fii . »

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee , he asked whether the man were a Galilaean .
text2: Bi Pilaat yégee baat yooyu , mu laajte ne : « Ndax nit kii Galile la dëkk ? »

text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod ' s jurisdiction , he sent him to Herod , who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time .
text2: Bi mu yégee ne , Yeesoo ngi nekk ci diiwaan bi Erodd yilif , mu yónnee ko Erodd , mi nekkoon ci jamono jooju ci Yerusalem .

text: And when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceeding glad : for he was desirous to see him of a long season , because he had heard many things of him ; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him .
text2: Bi Erodd gisee Yeesu , mu am mbég mu réy . Bu yàgg ba tey dafa koo bëggoon a gis , ndaxte déggoon na ñuy wax ci ay mbiram te yaakaaroon na ne , dina ko gis mu def kéemaan .

text: Then he questioned with him in many words ; but he answered him nothing .
text2: Noonu mu laaj ko ay laaj yu bare , waaye Yeesu tontuwul dara .

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him .
text2: Saraxalekat yu mag ya ak xutbakat yaa nga fa woon , di ko jiiñ bu metti .

text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought , and mocked him , and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe , and sent him again to Pilate .
text2: Noonu Erodd ak ay xarekatam toroxal Yeesu , di ko ñaawal . Gannaaw loolu mu solal ko mbubb mu rafet , delloo ko Pilaat .

text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together : for before they were at enmity between themselves .
text2: Erodd ak Pilaat dañoo ñi bañante woon bu jëkk , waaye ca bés booba doon nañu ay xarit .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
text2: Pilaat daldi woo saraxalekat yu mag ya , njiit ya ak mbooloom Yawut ya ne leen :

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: « Indil ngeen ma nit kii , ne ma , day jàddloo yoon mbooloo mi . Léegi nag man mii laaj naa ko ci seen kanam , waaye gisuma tooñ ci moom ak li ngeen koy jiiñ lépp .

text: No , nor yet Herod : for I sent you to him ; and , lo , nothing worthy of death is done unto him .
text2: Erodd itam gisul tooñ gu mu def , ndegam mu yónneewaat nu ko . Nit kii deful genn tooñ gu jar ñu koy rey .

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Kon nag dinaa ko dóorlu ay yar te bàyyi ko . »

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :
text2: Waaye ñu bokk di yuuxu , ñoom ñépp naan : « Reyal kii te bàyyi Barabas ! »

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )
text2: Dañoo tëjoon Barabas , ndaxte dafa jéem a tas dëkk ba , te rey nit .

text: Pilate therefore , willing to release Jesus , spake again to them .
text2: Pilaat waxaat ak mbooloo ma , ndaxte dafa bëggoon a bàyyi Yeesu .

text: But they cried , saying , Crucify him , crucify him .
text2: Waaye ñuy yuuxu naan : « Daaj ko ci bant ! Daaj ko ci bant , ba mu dee ! »

text: And he said unto them the third time , Why , what evil hath he done ? I have found no cause of death in him : I will therefore chastise him , and let him go .
text2: Pilaat ne leen ñetteel bi yoon : « Lu tax ? Gan tooñ la def ? Gisuma ci moom dara lu jar dee . Kon dinaa ko dóorlu ay yar te bàyyi ko . »

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .
text2: Waaye ñoom ñu sax ca la ñu waxoon , di gën a yuuxu naan , ñu daaj ko ci bant . Coow la yey Pilaat .

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required .
text2: Muj gi Pilaat dogal , ñu defal leen li ñu bëgg .

text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison , whom they had desired ; but he delivered Jesus to their will .
text2: Mu bàyyil leen ki ñu ko ñaanoon , kooku ñu tëjoon kaso , ndax tas réew ma ak rey nit . Waaye mu jébbal leen Yeesu ci seeni loxo .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: Bi ñuy yóbbu Yeesu , ñu jàpp ku ñuy wax Simoŋ te mu dëkk Siren , ku jóge ca wet , ga féete ak tool ya , sëf ko bant , ba ñuy war a daaj Yeesu , ngir mu gàddu ko , topp ci moom .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: Mbooloo mu baree nga ko toppoon , te jigéen ñu baree ngi doon yuuxu , di ko jooy .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Yeesu daldi walbatiku ca ñoom ne : « Yéen jigéeni Yerusalem , buleen ma jooy ! Jooyleen seen bopp ak seeni doom .

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Ndaxte jamono dina ñëw , ju ñu naan : “ Jigéen ñi musul a jur ak ñi musul a nàmpal , barkeel ngeen ! ”

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: Bu keroogee , “ Nit ñi dinañu ne tund yi : ‘ Daanuleen ci sunu kaw ! ’ te naan jànj yi : « “ Suul - leen nu ! » “ “

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Ndaxte su ñu defee nii garab gu tooy gi , lu ñuy def garab gu wow gi ? »

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: Yóbbaale nañu itam ñeneen , ñuy ñaari defkati lu bon , ngir rey leen .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: Bi xarekat ya agsee ba ca bérab , ba ñuy wooye Kaaŋu Bopp , ñu daaj fa Yeesu ca bant , daajaale ñaari defkati lu bon ya , kenn ca ndeyjooram , ka ca des ca càmmooñam .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Ci kaw loolu Yeesu ne : « Baay , baal leen , ndaxte xamuñu li ñuy def . » Xarekat ya tegoo ay bant yéreem , ngir séddoo ko .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: Mbooloo maa nga fa taxaw di seetaan . Njiit ya di ko reetaan naan : « Musal na ñeneen ; na musal boppam , su fekkee mooy Almasi bi , ki Yàlla fal ! »

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: Xarekat ya it di ko ñaawal . Ñu jegesi , jox ko bineegar te naan :

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: « Su fekkee ne yaay buuru Yawut yi , musalal sa bopp ! »

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Ñu daaj mbind , mu tiim ko naan : « Kii mooy buuru Yawut yi . »

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: Kenn ca defkatu lu bon ya ñu wékkoon ci bant , di ko xas , naan ko : « Xanaa du yaw yaay Almasi bi ? Musalal sa bopp te musal nu ! »

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Waaye ka ca des yedd moroom ma , naan ko : « Xanaa ragaloo Yàlla , yaw mi ñuy mbugal ni moom !

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: Nun yelloo nanu sunu mbugal , waaye moom deful dara . »

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: Noonu mu ne : « Yeesu , fàttaliku ma , boo dellusee ci sa nguur . »

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Ci dëgg maa ngi la koy wax , tey jii dinga texe ak man ca jataayu Yàlla . »

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: Noonu digg - bëccëg daldi jot , jant ba nëbbu , réew mépp daldi lëndëm këruus lu mat ñetti waxtu . Ridob bérab bu sell ba ca kër Yàlla ga daldi xar ñaar .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: Yeesu woote ak kàddu gu dëgër naan : « Baay , jébbal naa la sama ruu ! » Bi mu waxee loolu , mu delloo ruuwam Yàlla .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Bi njiitu xare ba gisee li xewoon , mu màggal Yàlla ne : « Dëgg - dëgg nit kii ku jub la woon . »

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: Nit ña fa dajaloo woon ñépp , di seetaan li xew , ba ñu gisee loolu , ñu dellu seen kër , fëgg seen dënn , di jooy .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: Xamey Yeesu yépp ak jigéen , ña ko toppe woon Galile , dand leen , di xool li xew .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: Nit ku ñuy wax Yuusufa dem ca Pilaat . Mi ngi dëkk Arimate ca diiwaanu Yude . Yuusufaa nga bokkoon ca kureelu àttekat yi . Nit ku baax la woon te jub , te àndul woon ci li ñu dogaloon te jëf ko . Da doon séentu nguuru Yàlla .

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: Mu dem ca Pilaat , laaj ko néewu Yeesu .

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: Gannaaw loolu mu wàcce ko ca bant ba , laxas ko ci càngaay , dugal ko cib bàmmeel bu ñu yett ciw doj te musuñu caa def kenn .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: Fekk bésu Waajal la woon , te bésu noflaay baa ngi doon tàmbali .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: Jigéen ña gungee woon Yeesu Galile , ànd ak Yuusufa , gis bàmmeel ba ak na ñu ca dence néewu Yeesu ba .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: Noonu ñu dellu defari cuuraay ak latkoloñ ngir néew ba . Ca bésu noflaay ba ñu noppalu , ni ko yoon wi santaanee .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Bés bu jëkk ca ayu - bés ga , jigéen ña jóg ca fajar , dem ca bàmmeel ba . Ñu ngi yoroon cuuraay lu ñu defaroon .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: Bi ñu agsee , ñu fekk ñu béraŋ doj , wa uboon bàmmeel ba .

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Ñu dugg ca bàmmeel ba , waaye fekkuñu fa néewu Boroom bi Yeesu .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: Noonu ba ñu nekkee ak seen njaaxle , am na ñaar ñu leen feeñu , sol yére yuy melax .

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: Jigéen ña am tiitaange ju mag , daldi dëpp seen jë ci suuf . Waaye ñu ne leen : « Lu tax ngeen di seet kiy dund ci biir néew yi ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Nekkatu fi ; dekki na . Fàttalikuleen la mu leen waxoon , ba mu nekkee Galile .

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: Nee woon na : “ Fàww ñu jébbal Doomu nit ki bàkkaarkat yi , ñu rey ko ci bant , mu dekki ca ñetteelu fan ba . ” »

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: Noonu ñu daldi fàttaliku kàdduy Yeesu ya .

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: Bi ñu jógee bàmmeel ba , ñu dem nettaliji loolu lépp fukki ndaw ya ak benn , ak ña ca des ñépp .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: Jigéen ña ñoo doon Maryaamam Magdala , Sànn , ak Maryaama yaayu Saag . Yeneen jigéen yi leen gunge woon itam nettali loolu ndaw ya .

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: Waaye ñu teg wax jooju ay jeneer , ba gëmuñu jigéen ñooñu .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Waaye Piyeer daldi jóg , daw , dem ca bàmmeel ba . Bi mu àggee , mu sëgg , yër , gisul lu dul càngaay la . Noonu mu dëpp ñibbi , jaaxle lool ci li xew .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: Ca bés boobu ñaar ci taalibe yi di dem ci dëkku Emayus , te mu sore Yerusalem ci lu mat fukki kilomet .

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: Ñu waxtaane li xewoon lépp .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: Bi ñuy waxtaan ak a sotteente xalaat , Yeesu ci boppam dab leen , ànd ak ñoom ,

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: fekk seeni bët muuru , ba mënu ko woon a xàmmi .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: Yeesu ne leen : « Lan ngeen di waxtaane nii ci yoon wi ? » Noonu ñu taxaw , seen xol jeex .

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: Kenn ci ñoom , ki tudd Këleyopas ne ko : « Xanaa yaw rekk yaa ñëw Yerusalem te umple li fi xewoon bés yii ? »

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: Yeesu ne leen : « Lu fi xew ? » Ñu tontu ko ne : « Mbirum Yeesum Nasaret . Ab yonent la woon bu doon def ay jëf yu mag , di wax ay kàddu yu am doole , ci kanam nit ñi ak ca kanam Yàlla .

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: Waaye sunuy saraxalekat yu mag ak sunuy njiit ñoo ko jébbal nguur gi ngir ñu àtte ko , teg ko dee , ba daaj ko ci bant .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Nun nag danoo yaakaaroon ne , mooy kiy nar a jot Israyil . Waaye bi loolu xewee ak léegi , tey la ñetteelu fan bi .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Teewul nag am na ay jigéen yu bokk ci nun yu nu jaaxal . Dañoo fajaru ca bàmmeel ba ,

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: waaye fekkuñu fa néewam . Ñu dellusi , nettali nu ne , ay malaaka feeñu nañu leen , yégal leen ne , mi ngi dund .

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: Ñenn ci sunu àndandoo yi dem nañu ca bàmmeel ba , fekk lépp mel , na ko jigéen ña waxe woon . Waaye moom gisuñu ko . »

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne leen : « Yéen daal , yéena ñàkk xel , te seen xol yéex a gëm li yonent yi yégle woon !

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: Xanaa du Almasi bi dafa waroon a daj boobu coono te dugg ci ndamam ? »

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: Noonu mu tàmbalee ci yonent Yàlla Musaa ba ci yonent yépp , tekkil leen li Mbind mi wax lépp ci ay mbiram .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: Bi ñuy jub dëkk , ba ñu jëmoon nag , Yeesu def ni kuy jubal yoonam .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Waaye ñu téye ko ne ko : « Toogal fii ci nun , ndaxte jant baa ngi so , te léegi mu guddi . » Noonu mu dugg , toog ca ñoom .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: Bi ñu tàmbali di reer , Yeesu jël mburu ma , gërëm Yàlla , ba noppi damm ko , jox leen ko .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: Bi mu defee loolu , lépp leer ci seeni bët , ñu daldi ko xàmmi . Waaye Yeesu ne mes , gisatuñu ko .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: Noonu ku nekk naan sa moroom : « Ndax sa xol seddul woon , bi muy wax ak nun ci yoon wi , te muy tekki Mbind mi ? »

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: Ñu daldi jóg ca saa sa , dellu Yerusalem , fekk fa fukki ndaw ya ak benn , ak yeneeni taalibe .

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: Ñooñu ne leen : « Dëgg la , Boroom bi dekki na , te feeñu na Simoŋ ! »

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Ñaari taalibe ya ñoom it daldi leen nettali la xewoon ca yoon wa ak ni ñu xàmmee Yeesu , bi mu dammee mburu ma .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Bi ñaari taalibe ya dee wax noonu , Yeesu taxaw moom ci boppam ci seen biir ne leen : « Na jàmm wàcc ci yéen . »

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Ñu daldi tiit , foog ne dañoo gis njuuma .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: Waaye Yeesu ne leen : « Lu tax ngeen jaaxle , ak lu tax ngeen di xel ñaar ci seen xol ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Xool - leen samay loxo ak samay tànk . Man mii la . Laal - leen ma te xam , njuuma amul yaram walla ay yax , ni ngeen gise , ma am ko . »

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: Bi mu leen waxee loolu , mu won leen ay loxoom ak ay tànkam .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: Waaye ba tey mënuñu woon a gëm ndax seen mbég ak jaaxle . Noonu Yeesu laaj leen ne : « Ndax am ngeen fii lu ñu lekk ? »

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: Ñu jox ko dogu jën wu ñu lakk .

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: Mu jël ko , lekk ci seen kanam .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: Noonu mu ne leen : « Bi ma nekkee ak yéen , waxoon naa leen baat yii : li ñu bind lépp ci samay mbir ci yoonu Musaa ak ci téerey yonent yi ak ci Sabóor dafa war a am . »

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Noonu mu ubbi seen xel , ngir ñu xam li Mbind mi di wax .

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: Mu ne leen : « Fàww Almasi bi sonn , mu dee te dekki ca ñetteelu fan ba , ni ñu ko binde ,

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: te it ñuy yégle xeet yépp ci turam , dale ko ci Yerusalem ne , war nañoo tuub seeni bàkkaar , Yàlla baal leen .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: Yéenay samay seede .

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: Te man dinaa leen yónnee li sama Baay dige . Yéen nag toogleen ci dëkk bi , ba ñu sol leen doole ji jóge ci kaw . »

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: Gannaaw loolu Yeesu yóbbu leen ca wetu Betani . Foofa mu yékkati ay loxoom , barkeel leen .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: Bi mu leen dee barkeel , mu tàggoo ak ñoom , Yàlla yéege ko asamaan .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: Taalibe ya màggal ko , daldi dellu Yerusalem , fees ak mbég .

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: Foofa daawuñu jóg ca kër Yàlla ga , di gërëm Yàlla .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: Ca njàlbéen ga fekk na Kàddu gi am , te Kàddu gi ma nga woon ak Yàlla , te Kàddu gi Yàlla la woon .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Moo di ki nekkoon ak Yàlla ca njàlbéen ga .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: Ci moom lañu sàkke lépp . Amul dara lu ñu sàkk lu jaarul ci moom .

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Ci moom la dund nekk , te dund googu mooy leeral nit ñi .

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: Leer gi feeñ na ci biir lëndëm , te lëndëm gi jàppu ko .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: Yàlla yónni woon na nit ku ñu naan Yaxya .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Kooku ñëw na , doon ab seede , ngir wax ci mbirum leer gi . Ñëw na ngir ñépp dégg li mu wax te gëm .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Moom ci boppam du woon leer gi , waaye ñëw na ngir seedeel leer gi .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Kàddu googu mooy leer gu wóor , giy ñëw ci àddina te di leeral nit ku nekk .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: Ci àddina la nekkoon , àddina si ñu sàkk jaarale ko ci moom , te àddina xamu ko .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Ñëw na ci réewam , te ay ñoñam nanguwuñu ko .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Teewul ñi ko nangu te gëm ci turam , may na leen , ñu am sañ - sañu nekk doomi Yàlla .

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: Ñooñu judduwuñu ci deret walla ci bëgg - bëggu yaram , walla ci coobarey nit . Ñu ngi juddu ci Yàlla .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: Kàddu gi ñëw , doon nit , dëkk ci sunu biir . Gis nañu ndamam , mu fees ak yiw ak dëgg , ndam li Baay bi jox jenn Doomam ji mu am kepp .

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Yaxyaa ngi koy seedeel te yégle na lii ; nee na : « Moo taxoon ma wax ne : “ Dina ñëw sama gannaaw waaye moo ma gën a màgg , ndaxte nekk na laata may juddu . ” »

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: Kàddu gi fees na ak yiw , te nun ñépp jot nanu ci sunu wàll , mu barkeel nu ay yooni - yoon .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Ndigali Yàlla yi , ci gémmiñu Musaa lañu leen jaarale ; yiw wi ak dëgg gi , Yeesu Kirist moo ko indaale .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Kenn musul a gis Yàlla , waaye Bàjjo bi , di Yàlla te nekk ak Baay bi , moo ko xamle .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: Lii mooy seedes Yaxya . Amoon na bés Yawut ya yónni ay saraxalekat ca Yaxya , ñu ànd ak ñu soqikoo ci giiru Lewi . Ñu nga jóge Yerusalem , ñëw ci moom , di ko laaj mooy kan .

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: Yaxya tontu na leen te nëbbu ci dara , wóoral na leen ne , moom du Almasi bi .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: Ñu laaj ko ne : « Kon yaay kan ? Ndax yaa di Iliyas ? » Mu ne leen : « Déedéet , duma Iliyas . » Ñu ne ko : « Ndax yaa di Yonent , bi war a ñëw ? » Mu tontu ne leen : « Déedéet . »

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Noonu ñu laaj ko ne : « Wax nu yaay kan , ngir nu man a tontu ñi nu yónni . Nga ne yaa di kan ? »

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: Yaxya tontu leen li yonent Yàlla Esayi waxoon ne : « Man maa di baat biy yégle ci màndiŋ mi ne : “ Xàll - leen yoonu Boroom bi ! ” »

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: Amoon na ñu bokk ca Farisen ya , yu àndoon ca mbooloo , ma ñu yónni woon ca Yaxya .

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: Ñooñu laaj ko ne : « Gannaaw doo Almasi bi , doo Iliyas , doo Yonent bi war a ñëw , lu tax ngay sóob nit ñi ci ndox ? »

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: Yaxya ne leen : « Man maa ngi sóobe ci ndox , waaye am na ci seen biir ku ngeen xamul .

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: Kookooy ñëw sama gannaaw , te man sax yeyoowumaa tekki ay dàllam . »

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Lii xewoon na ci dëkku Betani , ca gannaaw dexu Yurdan , fa Yaxya doon sóobe .

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Ca ëllëg sa , bi Yaxya gisee Yeesu , muy ñëw ci moom , mu ne : « Xool - leen ! Kii mooy mbotem Yàlla , mi ñu nar a rey , ngir dindi bàkkaaru àddina .

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Moo taxoon ma wax ne : “ Am na kuy ñëw sama gannaaw , waaye moo ma gën a màgg , ndaxte nekk na laata may juddu . ”

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: Xawma woon kooku kan la waroon a doon , waaye xamal ko bànni Israyil moo tax ma ñëw , di sóob nit ñi ci ndox . »

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: Ci kaw loolu Yaxya seede na lii : « Gis naa Xelu Yàlla mi ci melow pitax , mu jóge ci asamaan , tegu ci moom .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Bi loola laata am , xawma woon mooy kan , waaye Yàlla , mi ma yebal may sóobe ci ndox , nee woon na ma : “ Dinga gis Xel mu Sell mi wàcc , tegu ci kaw nit . Kooku moo di ki leen di sóob ci Xel mu Sell mi . ” »

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: Yaxya teg ca ne : « Gis naa loolu te seede naa ne , moom moo di Doomu Yàlla ji . »

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Ca ëllëg sa Yaxya taxawaatoon na ca bérab booba , ànd ak ñaari taalibeem .

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: Bi mu gisee Yeesu muy romb , mu daldi ne : « Kii mooy mbotem Yàlla mi ! »

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: Ñaari taalibe ya dégg li mu wax , daldi dem toppi Yeesu .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Yeesu geestu , gis ne , ñoo ngi koy topp . Mu ne leen : « Lu ngeen soxla woon ? » Ñu tontu ko : « Foo dëkk , Ràbbi ? » Ràbbi mi ngi tekki « Kilifa gi . »

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Yeesu ne leen : « Kaayleen gis . » Noonu ñu dem , seeti fa mu daloon , ngoonalal ko . Ci tàkkusaani kaw la woon .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Kenn ci ñoom ñaar , ñi déggoon li Yaxya wax te topp Yeesu , ma nga tuddoon Andare , mi bokkoon ak Simoŋ Piyeer ndey ak baay .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Andare dafa daldi dem seeti Simoŋ ne ko : « Gis nanu Almasi bi . » Baat boobu mi ngi tekki « Kirist . »

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: Noonu mu yóbbu ko ci Yeesu . Yeesu xool ko ne ko : « Yaa di Simoŋ , doomu Yowaana . Dinañu la wooye Sefas . » Sefas mi ngi tekki « Piyeer , » maanaam « xeer . »

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Ca ëllëg sa mu fas yéenee dem diiwaanu Galile te mu gis Filib . Yeesu ne ko : « Toppal ci man . »

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Filib mu nga dëkkoon Betsayda , dëkku Andare ak Piyeer .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Filib dajeek Nataneel ne ko : « Gis nanu ki yoonu Musaa wi ak yonent yi doon wax . Mu ngi tudd Yeesu , doomu Yuusufa , te dëkk Nasaret . »

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: Nataneel tontu ko ne : « Aa ! Ndax dara lu baax man na jóge Nasaret ? » Filib ne ko : « Ñëwal gis . »

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Naka la Yeesu gis Nataneel jëmsi ci moom , mu daldi ne ci mbiram : « Xool - leen , nitu Israyil dëgg a ngee di ñëw ; du dox benn tànku caaxaan . »

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Nataneel ne ko : « Noo ma xame ? » Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Bi la Filib di laata woo , gis naa la , bi nga nekkee ca ker garabu figg ga . »

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Nataneel wax ko ne : « Kilifa gi , yaay Doomu Yàlla ji , yaa di buuru Israyil ! »

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Ndax li ma ne , gis naa la ca ker garab ga , moo tax nga gëm ? Dinga gis mbir yu gën a réy yii . »

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: Noonu mu teg ca ne : « Ci dëgg - dëgg maa ngi leen koy wax , dingeen gis asamaan ubbiku , malaaka yiy baagante kaw ak suuf , di wàcc ci Doomu nit ki . »

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: Ñaari fan gannaaw loolu ag céet am ca dëkku Kana ca diiwaanu Galile . Yaayu Yeesu teewe woon na ko .

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: Woo woon nañu it Yeesu ca céet ga ak ay taalibeem .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: Ca biir xew wa , biiñ ba daldi jeex . Yaayu Yeesu ne ko : « Amatuñu biiñ . »

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Yeesu ne : « Soxna si , Loo ma bëggal ? Ndaxte sama waxtu jotagul . »

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Yaayam daldi ne surga ya : « Defleen lépp lu mu leen wax . »

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: Foofa amoon na fa juróom benni ndaa yu ñu yett ci doj , yu Yawut ya daan jëfandikoo ngir seen sangu set . Ndaa lu nekk man na def daanaka téeméeri liitar .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Yeesu ne surga ya : « Duyleen ndaa yi . » Ñu duy leen , ba ñu fees bay rembat .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: Noonu Yeesu ne leen : « Tanqleen ci léegi , yót ko njiitu xew wi . » Ñu daldi ko ciy yót .

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Ki jiite xew wa ñam ndox , ma Yeesu soppi biiñ . Xamul woon fu biiñ booba jóge , waaye surga ya tanqoon ndox ma , ñoom xamoon nañu ko . Naka noonu mu woo boroom céet ga ne ko :

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: « Ci xew yépp , naan gu neex gi lañuy jëkke . Bu nit ñi doyalee , ñu sog a génne ga ca des . Waaye yaw dangaa dencoon gi gën a neex ba nëgëni . »

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Firnde bii ame ca Kana , ca diiwaanu Galile , moo doon kéemaan gi Yeesu jëkk a def . Ci noonu la wonee màggaayam te ay taalibeem gëm nañu ko .

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Bi loolu weesoo , mu ànd ak yaayam , ay rakkam ak i taalibeem , dem dëkku Kapernawum . Waaye yàgguñu fa .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: Màggalu Yawut , gi ñuy wax bésu Jéggi ba , mu ngi doon jubsi . Yeesu dem Yerusalem ,

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: dugg ca kër Yàlla ga . Bi mu fa demee , fekk na ca ëtt ba ay jaaykati nag ak yu xar ak yu pitax , ak weccikatu xaalis ya toog .

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: Noonu Yeesu ràbb ab yar , daldi leen koy dàqe , ngir ñu génn ëttu kër Yàlla ga , ñoom ak xar ya ak nag ya . Mu tasaare xaalisu weccikat ya , daaneel taabal ya ,

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: daldi ne jaaykati pitax ya : « Jëleleen fi lii ! Sama kër Baay , buleen ko def marse ! »

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: Taalibeem ya fàttaliku Mbind mii : « Cawarte gi ma am ci sa kër , mu ngi mel ni taal buy tàkk ci sama biir . »

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Noonu Yawut ya ne ko : « Ban firnde nga nuy won ngir dëggal ne , am nga sañ - sañu def lii nga def ? »

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: Yeesu tontu leen : « Daaneel - leen kër Yàlla gii , ma daldi koy yékkati ci ñetti fan . »

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Ñu ne ko : « Nga ne kër Yàlla , gii ñu tabax ci ñeent - fukki at ak juróom benn , man nga koo yékkati ci ñetti fan ! »

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Waaye kër Yàlla , gi Yeesu doon wax , nekkul woon ab tabax , aw yaramam ci boppam moo ko taxoon di wax .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Gannaaw ga nag , bi Yeesu deeyee ba dekki , la taalibeem ya fàttaliku li mu waxoon , daldi gëm Mbind mi ak wax , ja leen Yeesu waxoon .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Bi Yeesu nekkee Yerusalem ci màggalu bésu Jéggi ba , ñu bare gis kéemaan , yi mu doon def , daldi gëm ci turam .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Waaye Yeesu wóoluwu leen woon , ndaxte xamoon na leen ñoom ñépp ,

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: te it soxlawul ñu koy xamal dara ci nit , ndaxte moom ci boppam xam na xolu nit .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: Amoon na ca Farisen ya nit ku ñu naan Nikodem te mu bokk ca kilifay Yawut ya .

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: Genn guddi mu ñëw ca Yeesu ne ko : « Kilifa gi , xam nanu ne , Yàllaa la yónni ngir nga jàngal nu , ndaxte kenn mënul a def firnde yii ngay wone te Yàlla àndul ak moom . »

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Ci dëgg - dëgg maa ngi la koy wax , képp ku judduwaatul doo man a seede nguuru Yàlla . »

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Nikodem ne ko : « Nit ku xas ba màggat , nan lay man a judduwaate ? Ndax day dellu ci biiru yaayam ngir judduwaat ? »

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Ci dëgg - dëgg maa ngi la koy wax , ku judduwul ci ndox ak ci Xelum Yàlla , doo man a bokk ci nguuru Yàlla .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
text2: Lu juddoo ci nit , nit la ; waaye lu juddoo ci Xelum Yàlla , xel la .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Li ma ne : “ Fàww ngeen judduwaat , ” bumu la jaaxal .

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Ngelaw fu ko neex lay jublu . Yaa ngi koy dégg waaye xamuloo fu mu jóge , xamuloo fu mu jëm . Noonu la mel it ci képp ku juddoo ci Xelum Yàlla . »

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Ci baat yooyu Nikodem ne ko : « Nu loolu man a ame ? »

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Yeesu tontu ko ne : « Yaw yaay jàngal bànni Israyil te xamuloo mbir yii ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Ci dëgg - dëgg maa ngi la koy wax , noo ngi wax li nu xam , di nettali li nu gis , waaye nanguwuleen a gëm li nu seede .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: Gannaaw gëmuleen li ma leen di wax ci mbiri àddina , naka ngeen man a gëme , bu ma leen waxee ci mbiri asamaan ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: Kenn musul a yéeg ci asamaan su dul ki fa jóge , muy Doomu nit ki .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: Te itam na Musaa sampe woon ab bant ca diggu màndiŋ ma , takk ca jaan , ja mu defare woon xànjar , fàww ñu yékkatee noonu Doomu nit ki ,

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: ngir képp ku ko gëm am ci moom dund gu dul jeex . »

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: Ndaxte Yàlla dafa bëgg àddina , ba joxe jenn Doomam ji mu am kepp , ngir képp ku ko gëm am dund gu dul jeex te doo sànku mukk .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Yàlla yónniwul Doomam ci àddina ngir mu daan nit ñi , waaye ngir musal leen .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: Képp ku ko gëm deesu la daan , waaye ku ko gëmul daan nañu la ba noppi , ndaxte gëmuloo ci turu Doom ji Yàlla am kepp .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: Ci nii la àtte bi ame : leer gi ñëw na ci àddina , waaye nit lëndëm gi lañu taamu ndax seeni jëf yu bon .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Képp kuy def lu bon day bañ leer gi te du ci ñëw , ndax ragal ay jëfam di feeñ bëccëgu ndarakàmm .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Waaye ku def lu jub day ñëw ci leer gi , ngir ñu xam ne , def na ay jëfam ci kanam Yàlla .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Gannaaw loolu Yeesu ànd ak ay taalibeem , dem ca biir diiwaanu Yude , toog fa ak ñoom ab diir , di sóob nit ñi ci ndox .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: Yaxya moom itam doon na sóobe ci ndox ci dëkku Aynon , ca wetu dëkku Salim , ndaxte diiwaan booba bare woon na ndox . Nit ñi daan nañu ñëw ci moom , mu di leen sóob .

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: Booba tëjaguñu Yaxya ci kaso .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Foofa ay taalibey Yaxya tàmbalee werante ak benn Yawut ci mbirum sangu set .

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: Ci kaw loolu ñu dem ca Yaxya ne ko : « Kilifa gi , ndax fàttaliku nga kooka nga seede woon te mu nekkoon ak yaw ca gannaaw dexu Yurdan ? Moom de , ma ngay sóobe ci ndox léegi te ñépp a ngay dem ca moom ! »

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Yaxya tontu leen : « Kenn mënul a am dara lu ko Yàlla joxul .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Yéen ci seen bopp man ngeen a seede ne , waxoon naa ne , duma Almasi bi waaye dañu maa yónni ma jiitusi ko .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: Kiy céetal moo moom séetam . Waaye xaritu kiy céetal dafay taxaw di ko déglu , tey bég , bu déggee baatam . Mbég moomu moo di sama bos tey , te fi mu nekk mat na sëkk .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Li war moo di moom , mu gën a màgg te man , ma gën a féete suuf . »

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: Ki jóge ci kaw moo féete kaw ñépp ; ki jóge ci suuf nag , ci suuf rekk la man a bokk , te ni niti àddina lay waxe . Ki jóge asamaan

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: day wax li mu gis ak li mu dégg , waaye kenn nanguwul li mu seede .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Képp ku nangu seedeem nangu nga ne Yàlla , dëgg lay wax .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Ndaw li Yàlla yónni , kàddug Yàlla lay wax , ndaxte mayu Xel mu Sell , mi Yàlla sol ci moom , amul dayo .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Baay bi dafa bëgg Doom ji , te jox na ko sañ - sañ ci lépp .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Ku gëm Doom ji , am nga dund gu dul jeex ; ku déggadil Doom ji , amuloo dund , waaye merum Yàllaa ngi la tiim .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: Amoon na benn bés Farisen yi dégg ne , ñiy topp Yeesu ñoo ëpp ñiy topp Yaxya , te ñi Yeesu sóob ci ndox ñoo ëpp ñi Yaxya sóob .

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: Fekk Yeesu moom ci boppam daawul sóob kenn ci ndox , waaye ay taalibeem ñoo daan sóobe .

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: Bi Yeesu yégee loolu nag , mu jóge Yude , dellu diiwaanu Galile .

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: Bi muy dem Galile , waroon na jaar ci diiwaanu Samari .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
