text: The children of thy elect sister greet thee . Amen .
text2: Say doomi rakk , ji Yàlla tànn , ñu ngi lay nuyu .

text: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius , whom I love in the truth .
text2: Man njiit li , maa ngi lay bind , yaw sama xarit Gayus , mi ma bëgg ci sama xol .

text: Beloved , I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health , even as thy soul prospereth .
text2: Sama soppe , maa ngi ñaan , Yàlla may la jàmm ci lépp , ànd ak wér gi yaram , ju mel ni sa naataangeg xol .

text: For I rejoiced greatly , when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee , even as thou walkest in the truth .
text2: Sunuy mbokk ñëw nañu , te seede ni nga fonke dëgg gi , ba wéer ci sa dund gépp , te bég naa ci lool .

text: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth .
text2: Awma mbég mu ëpp lii : ma dégg ne samay doomi diine ñu ngiy jaar ci tànki dëgg .

text: Beloved , thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren , and to strangers ;
text2: Yaw sama xarit , sa takkute fés na ci teeru bi ngay teeru mbokk yi , te fekk xamoo leen .

text: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church : whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort , thou shalt do well :
text2: Seedeel nañu sa mbëggeel fi kanam mbooloom ñi gëm . Taxawu leen nag ci seen yoon taxawu gu neex Yàlla .

text: Because that for his name ' s sake they went forth , taking nothing of the Gentiles .
text2: Ndaxte turu Krist la leen taxa jóg , te sàkkuwuñu daray ku gëmul .

text: We therefore ought to receive such , that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth .
text2: Nun nag fàww nu teeru ñu mel ni ñoom , ngir nu liggéeyandoo ak dëgg gi .

text: I wrote unto the church : but Diotrephes , who loveth to have the preeminence among them , receiveth us not .
text2: Bind naa mbooloo mi bataaxel , waaye Jotref , mi bëgg noot ñépp , du dégg sunu ndigal .

text: Wherefore , if I come , I will remember his deeds which he doeth , prating against us with malicious words : and not content therewith , neither doth he himself receive the brethren , and forbiddeth them that would , and casteth them out of the church .
text2: Kon nag su ma ñëwee , dinaa fàttali li mu def lépp , ci di nu sosal ci kàdduy neen yu ñaaw . Yemu foofu sax , waaye nanguwula teeru mbokk yi , rax - ca - dolli ku leen bëgga teeru , mu gàllankoor ko , dàq ko ci mbooloo mi .

text: Beloved , follow not that which is evil , but that which is good . He that doeth good is of God : but he that doeth evil hath not seen God .
text2: Sama xarit , bul roy lu bon , waaye lu baax rekk . Kuy def lu baax , ci Yàlla nga bokk ; kuy def lu bon , xamoo dara ci Yàlla .

text: Demetrius hath good report of all men , and of the truth itself : yea , and we also bear record ; and ye know that our record is true .
text2: Naka Démétrius nag , ñépp seedeel nañu ko lu baax , te dëgg gi sax seedeel na ko ko . Nun itam seedeel nanu ko te wóor na ma ne , sunu seede dëgg la .

text: I had many things to write , but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee :
text2: Am na lu bare , lu ma la bëggoona wax , waaye lépp xajul ci kayit .

text: But I trust I shall shortly see thee , and we shall speak face to face . Peace be to thee . Our friends salute thee . Greet the friends by name .
text2: Kon yaakaar naa laa seetsi balaa yàgg , jàkkaarlook yaw , nu waxtaan ci .

text: Jude , the servant of Jesus Christ , and brother of James , to them that are sanctified by God the Father , and preserved in Jesus Christ , and called :
text2: Man Yudd , jaamu Yeesu Kirist , mi bokk ak Saag ndey ak baay , maa leen di bind , yéen ñi Yàlla Baay bi woo te bëgg leen , te Yeesu Kirist aar leen .

text: Mercy unto you , and peace , and love , be multiplied .
text2: Na leen Yàlla may yërmande , jàmm ak mbëggeel .

text: Beloved , when I gave all diligence to write unto you of the common salvation , it was needful for me to write unto you , and exhort you that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints .
text2: Samay bokk , bëggoon naa leen a bind lool ci mbirum mucc gi nu bokk , waaye lii moo gën a jamp : ma xiir leen , ngeen taxaw ci aar mboolem dëgg , yi Yàlla xas a dénk gaayam yu sell yi ba fàww .

text: For there are certain men crept in unawares , who were before of old ordained to this condemnation , ungodly men , turning the grace of our God into lasciviousness , and denying the only Lord God , and our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Ndaxte am na ay nit ñu ñeme Yàlla , ñu yoxoosu ci seen biir ; dañuy mbubboo yiwu Yàlla , ngir topp seen bakkan , di ci weddi Buur Yàlla miy kenn ak sunu Boroom Yeesu Kirist . Fekk Mbind mi tëral na seen àtte bu yàgg .

text: I will therefore put you in remembrance , though ye once knew this , how that the Lord , having saved the people out of the land of Egypt , afterward destroyed them that believed not .
text2: Xam ngeen loolu lépp ba noppi sax , waaye dama leen koy fàttali rekk . Xam ngeen ne Boroom bi musal na xeetam , ba génne leen réewu Misra , waaye gannaaw ba raafal na ñi gëmul woon .

text: And the angels which kept not their first estate , but left their own habitation , he hath reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto the judgment of the great day .
text2: Te it malaaka ya jàppul woon ca daraja ja ñu amoon , xanaa toxoo fa ñu leen dëëloon , Yàlla yeew na leen buum yu sax , tëj leen ci biir lëndëm , di leen nége àtteb bés bu mag ba .

text: Even as Sodom and Gomorrha , and the cities about them in like manner , giving themselves over to fornication , and going after strange flesh , are set forth for an example , suffering the vengeance of eternal fire .
text2: Noonu itam dëkki Sodom ak Gomor ak dëkk ya leen wëroon , dañoo sóobu ci njaaloo ak di def ay góor - jigéen , waaye àtte bi dal na ci seen kaw , ba ñuy ay tegtal ci ñiy yelloo safara ba fàww .

text: Likewise also these filthy dreamers defile the flesh , despise dominion , and speak evil of dignities .
text2: Naka noonu itam gentkat yooyu may wax ñu ngi sobeel seen yaram , di weddi gépp kilifteef , di xas doole yi ci asamaan .

text: Yet Michael the archangel , when contending with the devil he disputed about the body of Moses , durst not bring against him a railing accusation , but said , The Lord rebuke thee .
text2: Waaye bi Mikayel , miy kilifa ci malaaka yi , di xëccook Seytaane néewu Musaa , bay xuloo ak moom , ñemewu koo àtte , boole ciy xas ; mu yem ci wax ko ne : « Na la Boroom bi mbugal ! »

text: But these speak evil of those things which they know not : but what they know naturally , as brute beasts , in those things they corrupt themselves .
text2: Waaye nit ñii may wax , dañuy saaga li ñu xamul . Te li ñu xam ci tañaxu sax , ni bàyyima yu amul xel , dañu ci yàq seen bopp .

text: Woe unto them ! for they have gone in the way of Cain , and ran greedily after the error of Balaam for reward , and perished in the gainsaying of Core .
text2: Ñoo kay torox ! Dañoo jaar ci yoonu Kayin , sóobu ci réerug Balaam ngir xaalis , di bañ kilifteef ni Kore , te dinañu dee ni moom .

text: These are spots in your feasts of charity , when they feast with you , feeding themselves without fear : clouds they are without water , carried about of winds ; trees whose fruit withereth , without fruit , twice dead , plucked up by the roots ;
text2: Su ñu bokkee ak yéen reeru mbooloo mi , dañu ciy indi ay , niy xeer yu nëbbu ci biir géej ; amuñu genn gàcce , waaye dañuy giiroo te fonk seen biir rekk . Ñu ngi mel ni xiin yu amul ndox , yuy naaxsaay ci ngelaw ; ni garab yu meññul ci jamonoy meññeef , te buddeeku , dee ba wow koŋŋ ;

text: Raging waves of the sea , foaming out their own shame ; wandering stars , to whom is reserved the blackness of darkness for ever .
text2: mel ni duusi géej gu mer , yuy gëq jëf yu ruslu ; niy biddiiw yuy faq , te Yàlla dencal na leen lëndëm ya gën a tar ba fàww .

text: And Enoch also , the seventh from Adam , prophesied of these , saying , Behold , the Lord cometh with ten thousands of his saints ,
text2: Enog , di juróom - ñaareelu maam gannaaw Aadama , waxoon na ci kàddug Yàlla , ba weer leen ne : « Boroom bi wàcce na ca asamaan , ànd ak ay junniy junniy malaakaam ,

text: To execute judgment upon all , and to convince all that are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have ungodly committed , and of all their hard speeches which ungodly sinners have spoken against him .
text2: ngir àtte ñépp , te mbugal ñi weddi ñépp ndax ñaawteef , yi ñu jëf ci ñeme Yàlla ; di leen fàttali it kàddu yu ñaaw , yi ñu ko tifaar ci seeni bàkkaar ak seen weddi . »

text: These are murmurers , complainers , walking after their own lusts ; and their mouth speaketh great swelling words , having men ' s persons in admiration because of advantage .
text2: Duñu noppee xultu , di jàmbat seen nekkin , tey topp seen nafsu ; ay wax yu réy a ngi ball ci seen làmmiñ , waaye dañuy jey ñi ñuy yaakaare njariñ .

text: But , beloved , remember ye the words which were spoken before of the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ ;
text2: Waaye yéen samay xarit , fàttalikuleen la leen ndawi sunu Boroom Yeesu Kirist waxoon lu jiitu ,

text: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time , who should walk after their own ungodly lusts .
text2: ne leen : « Muju jamono ay tiiñalkat dinañu feeñ , ñuy weddi Yàlla , ngir topp seen bakkan . »

text: These be they who separate themselves , sensual , having not the Spirit .
text2: Ñooy féewale , te Xelum Yàlla nekkul ci ñoom , waaye niti kese lañu .

text: But ye , beloved , building up yourselves on your most holy faith , praying in the Holy Ghost ,
text2: Waaye yéen samay xarit , doolewuleen ci seen yoonu ngëm wu sell , tey ñaan ci dooley Xel mu Sell mi ,

text: Keep yourselves in the love of God , looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life .
text2: ba saxoo mbëggeelu Yàlla , tey séentu yërmandey sunu Boroom Yeesu Kirist , mu tàbbal leen ci dund gu dul jeex .

text: And of some have compassion , making a difference :
text2: Jubbantileen ñi am werantey xel ,

text: And others save with fear , pulling them out of the fire ; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh .
text2: ngeen musal ñale , jële leen ci safara , te yërëm ñeneen ñi , waaye boole ci moytu , ba sib sax seen yére yi taq sobe .

text: Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling , and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy ,
text2: Yàlla mi leen man a aar ci gépp jeng , te teewal leen fa kanam ndamam , ngeen ñàkk sikk te fees dell ak mbég ;

text: To the only wise God our Saviour , be glory and majesty , dominion and power , both now and ever . Amen .
text2: Yàlla miy kenn , di sunu Musalkat , na yelloo ndam ak màgg , kàttan ak nguur , jaar ci Yeesu Kirist sunu Boroom , démb , tey , ëllëg ba fàww . Amiin .

text: The Revelation of Jesus Christ , which God gave unto him , to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass ; and he sent and signified it by his angel unto his servant John :
text2: Lii mooy li Yeesu Kirist feeñal , te mu tukkee ca Yàlla , ngir mu won ay jaamam mbir , yi dëgmël di ñëw . Yónni na malaakaam , ngir xamal ko ab jaamam Yowaana .

text: Who bare record of the word of God , and of the testimony of Jesus Christ , and of all things that he saw .
text2: Kooku mi ngi seede fii li mu gis lépp , maanaam kàddug Yàlla ak seede , si ñu seedeel Yeesu Kirist .

text: Blessed is he that readeth , and they that hear the words of this prophecy , and keep those things which are written therein : for the time is at hand .
text2: Barkeel ngeen , yaw miy jàng ak yéen ñiy déglu wax yii jóge ca Yàlla , te di sàmm li ñu ci bind , ndaxte waxtu wi jege na .

text: John to the seven churches which are in Asia : Grace be unto you , and peace , from him which is , and which was , and which is to come ; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne ;
text2: Man Yowaana maa leen di bind , yéen juróom - ñaari mboolooy ñi gëm te nekk ci diiwaanu Asi . Na yiw ak jàmm féete ci yéen , jóge ci Yàlla , moom ki nekk , ki nekkoon démb te di ñëw ëllëg . Yiw woowu ak jàmm jooju ñoo ngi tukkee it ci juróom - ñaari Xeli Yàlla , yi nekk ci kanamu gàngunem Yàlla ,

text: And from Jesus Christ , who is the faithful witness , and the first begotten of the dead , and the prince of the kings of the earth . Unto him that loved us , and washed us from our sins in his own blood ,
text2: tukkee it ci Yeesu Kirist , seede bu takku bi , moom taaw bi , maanaam ki jëkk a dekki , di buuru buur yi ci kaw suuf yépp . Na ndam ak nguur féete ak Yeesu Kirist ba fàww , moom mi nu bëgg te yiwi nu ci sunuy bàkkaar ak deretam ji tuuru , te def nu askanu saraxalekati Buur Yàlla Baayam , nu di ko jaamu . Amiin .

text: Behold , he cometh with clouds ; and every eye shall see him , and they also which pierced him : and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him . Even so , Amen .
text2: Gisleen , mi ngi ñëw ci niir yi , te ñépp dinañu teg seeni bët ci moom , ba ci ñi ko jam sax . Te xeet yi nekk ci kaw suuf yéppdinañu jooy ndax moom . Waaw . Amiin .

text: I am Alpha and Omega , the beginning and the ending , saith the Lord , which is , and which was , and which is to come , the Almighty .
text2: Boroom bi Yàlla nee na : « Man Yàlla maay Alfa ak Omega , maay ki nekk , ki nekkoon démb te di ñëw ëllëg , man Aji Kàttan ji . »

text: I John , who also am your brother , and companion in tribulation , and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ , was in the isle that is called Patmos , for the word of God , and for the testimony of Jesus Christ .
text2: Man Yowaana seen mbokk , di seen nawle ci fitna , ci nguur ak ci muñ , yi nu am ndax sunu booloo ak Yeesu , maa nga nekkoon ca dun bu ñuy wax Patmos . Wacce woon nañu ma fa , ndax li ma doon waare kàddug Yàlla tey seedeel Yeesu .

text: I was in the Spirit on the Lord ' s day , and heard behind me a great voice , as of a trumpet ,
text2: Xelum Yàlla solu ma ci bésu Boroom bi , te noonu ma dégg ci sama gannaaw baat bu xumb nig liit ,

text: Saying , I am Alpha and Omega , the first and the last : and , What thou seest , write in a book , and send it unto the seven churches which are in Asia ; unto Ephesus , and unto Smyrna , and unto Pergamos , and unto Thyatira , and unto Sardis , and unto Philadelphia , and unto Laodicea .
text2: naan : « Bindal ci téere li ngay gis te yónnee ko juróom - ñaari mboolooy ñi gëm , ca dëkki Efes , Samirin , Pergam , Catir , Sàrd , Filadelfi ak Lawdise . »

text: And I turned to see the voice that spake with me . And being turned , I saw seven golden candlesticks ;
text2: Noonu ma geestu , ngir seet ku doon wax ak man . Ba ma geestoo , yem ci juróom - ñaari làmpi diwlin yu wurus ,

text: And in the midst of the seven candlesticks one like unto the Son of man , clothed with a garment down to the foot , and girt about the paps with a golden girdle .
text2: gis ku taxaw ci biir làmp ya , niroo ak doomu nit . Mu sol mbubb mu gudd , takk ngeñaayu wurus ci ndiggam .

text: His head and his hairs were white like wool , as white as snow ; and his eyes were as a flame of fire ;
text2: Boppam ak kawaram weex tàll ni perkaal , ay bëtam di xuyy ni safara .

text: And his feet like unto fine brass , as if they burned in a furnace ; and his voice as the sound of many waters .
text2: Ay tànkam mel ni xànjar bu yànj bu ñu xelli , baatam di riir ni duusi géej .

text: And he had in his right hand seven stars : and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword : and his countenance was as the sun shineth in his strength .
text2: Mu yor ci loxol ndeyjooram juróom - ñaari biddiiw , jaasiy ñaari boor yu ñaw di génn ci gémmiñam , xar - kanamam leer nàññ ni jantub njolloor .

text: And when I saw him , I fell at his feet as dead . And he laid his right hand upon me , saying unto me , Fear not ; I am the first and the last :
text2: Naka laa ko gis , di daanu ci ay tànkam ni ku dee . Waaye mu teg loxol ndeyjooram ci sama kaw ne ma : « Bul ragal dara . Maay ki jëkk te maay mujj .

text: I am he that liveth , and was dead ; and , behold , I am alive for evermore , Amen ; and have the keys of hell and of death .
text2: Maay Kiy Dund . Dee woon naa , waaye maa ngii di dund ba fàww , yor caabiy dee ak ju barsàq .

text: Write the things which thou hast seen , and the things which are , and the things which shall be hereafter ;
text2: Kon nag bindal li nga gis , li am léegi ak li nar a ami gannaaw gi .

text: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand , and the seven golden candlesticks . The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches : and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches .
text2: Juróom - ñaari biddiiw yi nga gis ci sama loxol ndeyjoor , ak juróom - ñaari làmpi diwlin yu wurus yi , ay mbóoti Yàlla lañu te lii lañuy tekki : biddiiw yi ñoo di malaakay juróom - ñaari mboolooy ñi gëm ; juróom - ñaari làmp yi ñoo di juróom - ñaari mbooloo yi .

text: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write ; These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand , who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks ;
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Efes , ne ko : i Ki téye juróom - ñaari biddiiw yi ci loxol ndeyjooram , tey dox ci diggu juróom - ñaari làmpi diwlin yu wurus yi nee na :

text: I know thy works , and thy labour , and thy patience , and how thou canst not bear them which are evil : and thou hast tried them which say they are apostles , and are not , and hast found them liars :
text2: Xam naa say jëf , sa liggéey ak sag muñ . Xam naa ne , mënuloo dékku ñiy def lu bon . Seetlu nga ñi tuddoo samay ndaw , ba gis ne ay naaféq lañu .

text: And hast borne , and hast patience , and for my name ' s sake hast laboured , and hast not fainted .
text2: Xam naa it ne muñ nga , ba dékku coono ndax sama tur , te xàddiwoo . i

text: Nevertheless I have somewhat against thee , because thou hast left thy first love .
text2: Waaye li ma naqari ci yaw moo di sa mbëggeel wàññiku na .

text: Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen , and repent , and do the first works ; or else I will come unto thee quickly , and will remove thy candlestick out of his place , except thou repent .
text2: Deel fàttaliku kon fa nga daanoo . Réccul te def , na nga daan def bu jëkk . Soo réccuwul , dinaa dikk ci yaw , jële sa làmp ca bérab ba mu nekk .

text: But this thou hast , that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitans , which I also hate .
text2: Waaye lii neex na ma ci yaw : sib nga ni man li ñoom Nikolas di jëf . i

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches ; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of life , which is in the midst of the paradise of God .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm . Ku daan , dinaa la may , nga lekk ci garabu dund , gi nekk ci jataayu Yàlla .

text: And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write ; These things saith the first and the last , which was dead , and is alive ;
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Samirin , ne ko : i Ki jëkk te mujj , ki dee woon te dekki nee na :

text: I know thy works , and tribulation , and poverty , ( but thou art rich ) and I know the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews , and are not , but are the synagogue of Satan .
text2: Xam naa sa coono , xam it sa néew doole , moona yaaka duunle . Ñooñu tuddoo Yawut , xam naa ñaawteef yi ñu teg ci sa der : ndajem Seytaane la .

text: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer : behold , the devil shall cast some of you into prison , that ye may be tried ; and ye shall have tribulation ten days : be thou faithful unto death , and I will give thee a crown of life .
text2: Bul ragal li nga nar a daj . Seytaane dina dugal kaso ñenn ci yéen , ngir wut leen a fiir . Diirub fukki fan dingeen am coono . Nanga takku ba àttan cee dee , ma jox la kaalag dund gi . i

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches ; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm . Ku daan , doo loru ci ñaareelu dee .

text: And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write ; These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges ;
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Pergam , ne ko : i Boroom jaasi ju ñaw , ji am ñaari boor nee na :

text: I know thy works , and where thou dwellest , even where Satan ' s seat is : and thou holdest fast my name , and hast not denied my faith , even in those days wherein Antipas was my faithful martyr , who was slain among you , where Satan dwelleth .
text2: Xam naa fa nga dëkk , di fa Seytaane samp nguuram . Moona jébbalu nga ci sama tur te weddiwoo sa ngëm ci man , ba ca fan ya ñu reye Antipas , sama seede bu takku ba , ci seen dëkk , di dëkku Seytaane . i

text: But I have a few things against thee , because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam , who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel , to eat things sacrificed unto idols , and to commit fornication .
text2: Waaye am na lu ma naqari ci yaw , moo di uuf nga foofu gaa yuy sàmm njàngalem Balaam , moom mi jàngaloon Balag , mu sóob bànni Israyil ci bàkkaar , xiir leen ci lekk ñam wu ñu tuuroo xërëm yi , xiir leen ci njaaloo .

text: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans , which thing I hate .
text2: Te am nga noonu itam ay nit ñuy sàmm njàngalem ñoom Nikolas .

text: Repent ; or else I will come unto thee quickly , and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth .
text2: Réccul kon ; lu ko moy dinaa dikk ci yaw léegi te xeex ak nit ñooñu ak jaasi , jiy génn ci sama gémmiñ . i

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches ; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna , and will give him a white stone , and in the stone a new name written , which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth it .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm . Ku daan , dinaa la jox , nga lekk dund bi ñuy wax mànn te mu nëbbu , te dinaa la jox xeer wu weex . Ci kaw xeer woowu bindees na ci tur wu bees wu kenn xamul , ku dul ki ko jot .

text: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write ; These things saith the Son of God , who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire , and his feet are like fine brass ;
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Catir , ne ko : i Doomu Yàlla ji , ki ay bëtam di xuyy ni safara , tey tànkam di lerax ni xànjar , nee na :

text: I know thy works , and charity , and service , and faith , and thy patience , and thy works ; and the last to be more than the first .
text2: Xam naa say jëf , sa mbëggeel , sa ngëm , sag muñ ak ni nga farloo ci sa jaamu Yàlla . Xam naa say jëf yu mujj , ni ñu ëppe yu jëkk ya . i

text: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee , because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel , which calleth herself a prophetess , to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication , and to eat things sacrificed unto idols .
text2: Waaye li ma naqari ci yaw moo di dangaa bàyyi Yesabel , jigéen joojuy tuddoo yonent , di jàngale ak a réeral sama jaam yi , ngir ñuy sóobu ci njaaloo te di lekk ñam wu ñu tuuroo xërëm yi .

text: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication ; and she repented not .
text2: May naa ko ab diir , ngir mu tuub njaaloom , waaye bañ na .

text: Behold , I will cast her into a bed , and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation , except they repent of their deeds .
text2: Kon nag dinaa ko tëral ci lalu metit , te ñiy ànd ak moom di njaaloo , su ñu tuubul jëfi jigéen jooju , dinaa leen teg naqar wu mag .

text: And I will kill her children with death ; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts : and I will give unto every one of you according to your works .
text2: Dinaa rey ay doomam , te mboolooy ñi gëm yépp dinañu xam ne , man maa di kiy nattu xol ak xalaat , te dinaa fey ku nekk ay jëfam .

text: But unto you I say , and unto the rest in Thyatira , as many as have not this doctrine , and which have not known the depths of Satan , as they speak ; I will put upon you none other burden .
text2: Waaye yéen ñépp ñi des ci Catir te toppuleen njàngale moomu te gëstuwuleen loolu ñu naan mbiri Seytaane yu xóot yi , maa ngi leen di wax ne , duma leen yen beneen yen

text: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come .
text2: bu dul bii : jàppleen ci li ngeen jàpp , ba kera may ñëw . i

text: And he that overcometh , and keepeth my works unto the end , to him will I give power over the nations :
text2: Ku daan tey sax ci samay jëf ba ca muj ga , dinaa ko jox sañ - sañ ci xeet yi : i

text: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron ; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers : even as I received of my Father .
text2: Dina leen jiite ak yetu weñ , i tojat leen ni ñuy toje ndaal kew — i

text: And I will give him the morning star .
text2: ni ma jële sañ - sañ ci sama Baay . Dinaa ko jox it biddiiwu njël .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm .

text: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write ; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God , and the seven stars ; I know thy works , that thou hast a name that thou livest , and art dead .
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Sàrd , ne ko : i Ki yor juróom - ñaari Xeli Yàlla yi ak juróom - ñaari biddiiw yi nee na : Xam naa say jëf . Dañu laa teg kuy dund , fekk dee nga .

text: Be watchful , and strengthen the things which remain , that are ready to die : for I have not found thy works perfect before God .
text2: Yeewul te dëgëral li des ci yaw tey waaj a dee , ndaxte gis naa ne , say jëf matuñu ca sama kanam Yàlla .

text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard , and hold fast , and repent . If therefore thou shalt not watch , I will come on thee as a thief , and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee .
text2: Fàttalikul kon kàddug Yàlla gi nga jot , te dégg ko , sàmm ko te réccu . Soo wéyee ciy nelaw nag , dinaa ñëw nib sàcc , te doo xam wan waxtu lay doon . i

text: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments ; and they shall walk with me in white : for they are worthy .
text2: Moona am nga foofu ci Sàrd nit ñu néew ñoo xam ne tilimaluñu seen mbubb . Ñooñu dinañu ànd ak man , sol lu weex , ndaxte yeyoo nañu ko .

text: He that overcometh , the same shall be clothed in white raiment ; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life , but I will confess his name before my Father , and before his angels .
text2: Ku daan , dinga sol mbubb mu weex ni ñoom . Te duma far sa tur ci téereb dund bi , waaye dinaa nangu ci sama kanamu Baay ak ay malaakaam ne , bokk nga ci man .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm .

text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write ; These things saith he that is holy , he that is true , he that hath the key of David , he that openeth , and no man shutteth ; and shutteth , and no man openeth ;
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Filadelfi , ne ko : i Aji Sell ji , di Aji Dëgg ji nee na , moom mi yor caabiy Daawuda ji , moom miy tijji te kenn du ko man a tëj , muy tëj te kenn du ko tijji nee ne :

text: I know thy works : behold , I have set before thee an open door , and no man can shut it : for thou hast a little strength , and hast kept my word , and hast not denied my name .
text2: Xam naa say jëf . Ubbil naa la bunt , te kenn du ko man a tëj . Xam naa ne barewuloo doole , waaye sàmm nga sama kàddu te weddiwoo ma .

text: Behold , I will make them of the synagogue of Satan , which say they are Jews , and are not , but do lie ; behold , I will make them to come and worship before thy feet , and to know that I have loved thee .
text2: Dinaa def ba ñenn ci ñi bokk ci ndajem Seytaane - - te tuddoo Yawut , fekk dañuy fen — dinaa leen ñëwloo , ñu sukk ci sa kanam , nangu ne , bëgg naa la .

text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience , I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation , which shall come upon all the world , to try them that dwell upon the earth .
text2: Gannaaw muñ nga , ni ma la ko dénke woon , man itam dinaa la yiir ci jamono , ji musiba mi di wàcc ci dunyaa bépp ngir nattu waa àddina . i

text: Behold , I come quickly : hold that fast which thou hast , that no man take thy crown .
text2: Léegi ma ñëw . Sàmmal li nga yor , ngir kenn bañ laa xañ sa kaalag ndam .

text: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God , and he shall go no more out : and I will write upon him the name of my God , and the name of the city of my God , which is new Jerusalem , which cometh down out of heaven from my God : and I will write upon him my new name .
text2: Ku daan , dinaa la samp ni aw jënu néeg ci sama kër Yàlla te doo fa génn mukk . Dinaa bind ci yaw turu sama Yàlla ak turu dëkku sama Yàlla , mu di Yerusalem gu bees , giy jóge ca asamaan ca wetu sama Yàlla di wàcc . Dinaa bind it ci yaw sama tur wu bees .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm .

text: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write ; These things saith the Amen , the faithful and true witness , the beginning of the creation of God ;
text2: « Bindal malaakam mbooloom ñi gëm ci dëkku Lawdise , ne ko : i Ki ñuy wax Amiin ji , di seede bu takku bi te dëggu , ki di ndeyi bindu mbindeefi Yàlla yi , nee na ;

text: I know thy works , that thou art neither cold nor hot : I would thou wert cold or hot .
text2: Xam naa say jëf , xam ne seddoo , tàngoo . Manoon ngaa sedd mbaa nga tàng ,

text: So then because thou art lukewarm , and neither cold nor hot , I will spue thee out of my mouth .
text2: waaye ndax li nga nugg , tàngoo seddoo , dinaa la yàbbi .

text: Because thou sayest , I am rich , and increased with goods , and have need of nothing ; and knowest not that thou art wretched , and miserable , and poor , and blind , and naked :
text2: Yaa ngi damu naan : “ Am naa alal , duunle naa , soxlaatuma dara . ” Fekk xamuloo ne , torox nga , miskin , ñàkk , gumba te rafle .

text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire , that thou mayest be rich ; and white raiment , that thou mayest be clothed , and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear ; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve , that thou mayest see .
text2: Moo tax maa ngi lay xiirtal , nga jënd ci man wurus wu ñu xellee ci safara , ngir nga duunle , te nga jënd yére yu weex ngir nga solu , ba sa gàcceg rafle bañ a feeñ , ak tuufaay booy diw ci say bët , ngir man a gis . i

text: As many as I love , I rebuke and chasten : be zealous therefore , and repent .
text2: Man maay yedd , di yar ñépp ñi ma bëgg . Farlul kon te tuub say bàkkaar .

text: Behold , I stand at the door , and knock : if any man hear my voice , and open the door , I will come in to him , and will sup with him , and he with me .
text2: Maa ngi nii taxaw ci bunt bi , di fëgg . Ku dégg sama baat te ubbi bunt bi , dinaa dugg , reerandoo ak moom , moom it mu reerandoo ak man . i

text: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne , even as I also overcame , and am set down with my Father in his throne .
text2: Ku daan , dinaa la toogloo ci sama wet ci sama gàngune , ni ma xeexe ba daan , man ci sama bopp , te toogandoo ak sama Baay ci gànguneem .

text: He that hath an ear , let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul li Xelum Yàlla di wax mboolooy ñi gëm . »

text: After this I looked , and , behold , a door was opened in heaven : and the first voice which I heard was as it were of a trumpet talking with me ; which said , Come up hither , and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter .
text2: Gannaaw loolu ma xool , gis bunt ubbiku ci asamaan . Baat booba ma déggoon , muy wax ak man mel nig liit , ne ma : « Yéegal fii , ma won la li war a ñëw gannaaw gi . »

text: And immediately I was in the spirit : and , behold , a throne was set in heaven , and one sat on the throne .
text2: Ca saa sa Xelum Yàlla solu ma , noonu ma gis gàngune ca asamaan , te am ku ca toog .

text: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone : and there was a rainbow round about the throne , in sight like unto an emerald .
text2: Leeraayam mel ni jamaa ak per bu xonq , te xon gu leer ni per bu wert wër gàngune ma .

text: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats : and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting , clothed in white raiment ; and they had on their heads crowns of gold .
text2: Yeneen ñaar - fukki gàngune ak ñeent wër ko , te ci kaw gàngune ya ñaar - fukki mag ak ñeent toog , sol mbubb yu weex ak kaalay wurus ci seen bopp .

text: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices : and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne , which are the seven Spirits of God .
text2: Ay melax , ay riir ak ay dënnu di jibe ca gàngune ma . Ca kanamu gàngune ma amoon na fa juróom - ñaari làmp yu yànj , di juróom - ñaari Xeli Yàlla yi .

text: And before the throne there was a sea of glass like unto crystal : and in the midst of the throne , and round about the throne , were four beasts full of eyes before and behind .
text2: Amoon na it ca kanamu gàngune ma lu mel ni géej gu leer ni weer bu set , ba mel ni seetu . Ci li wër gàngune ma , sës rëkk , amoon na fa ñeenti mbindeef yu fees ak ay bët ci kanam ak ci gannaaw .

text: And the first beast was like a lion , and the second beast like a calf , and the third beast had a face as a man , and the fourth beast was like a flying eagle .
text2: Mbindeef mu jëkk maa nga meloon ni gaynde , ñaareelu mbindeef mel ni yëkk , ñetteelu mbindeef yor kanamu nit , ñeenteel ba di nirook jaxaay juy naaw .

text: And the four beasts had each of them six wings about him ; and they were full of eyes within : and they rest not day and night , saying , Holy , holy , holy , Lord God Almighty , which was , and is , and is to come .
text2: Ñeenti mbindeef ya am nañu ku nekk juróom - benni laaf te ñu nga fees ak ay bët li leen wër lépp , ba ci seen roni laaf . Guddi ak bëccëg duñu noppeek naan : « Boroom bi Yàlla , Aji Kàttan ji , moo sell , sell , sell , moom ki nekkoon démb , ki nekk tey , te di ñëw ëllëg . »

text: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne , who liveth for ever and ever ,
text2: Saa su mbindeef ya di màggal ki toog ca gàngune ma tey dund ba fàww , te di ko kañ ak a gërëm ,

text: The four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne , and worship him that liveth for ever and ever , and cast their crowns before the throne , saying ,
text2: ñaar - fukki mag ña ak ñeent di dëpp seen jë ca kanamu ka toog ca kaw gàngune ma . Ñu di ko jaamu , moom mi dund ba fàww , di sànni seen kaalay ndam ca kanamu gàngune ma , naan :

text: Thou art worthy , O Lord , to receive glory and honour and power : for thou hast created all things , and for thy pleasure they are and were created .
text2: « Yàlla sunu Boroom , yaa yeyoo ndam , teraanga ak kàttan , ndaxte yaa sàkk léppte ci sa coobare la lépp nekke , te ci lañu leen sàkke . »

text: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside , sealed with seven seals .
text2: Noonu ma gis ca loxol ndeyjooru ka toog ca gàngune ma téere bu ñu bind biir ak biti , tay ko juróom - ñaari yoon ak sondeel .

text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice , Who is worthy to open the book , and to loose the seals thereof ?
text2: Noonu ma gis malaaka mu am doole , muy xaacu naan : « Ku yeyoo dindi tayu yi te ubbi téere bi ? »

text: And no man in heaven , nor in earth , neither under the earth , was able to open the book , neither to look thereon .
text2: Te amul kenn , muy ci asamaan , muy ci kaw suuf , muy ci biir suuf , ku manoon a ubbi téere bi , mbaa mu xool ci biir .

text: And I wept much , because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book , neither to look thereon .
text2: Ma jooy jooy yu metti ndax li kenn yeyoowul woon a ubbi téere bi mbaa mu xool ko .

text: And one of the elders saith unto me , Weep not : behold , the Lion of the tribe of Juda , the Root of David , hath prevailed to open the book , and to loose the seven seals thereof .
text2: Noonu kenn ca mag ña ne ma : « Bul jooy . Xoolal , Gayndeg giiru Yuda , ki soqikoo ci Daawuda , daan na , ba am sañ - sañu dindi tayu yi te ubbi téere bi . »

text: And I beheld , and , lo , in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts , and in the midst of the elders , stood a Lamb as it had been slain , having seven horns and seven eyes , which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth .
text2: Noonu ma gis Mbote mu mel ni dañu koo rendi woon , mu taxaw ca digg gàngune ma , ñeenti mbindeef ya séq ko , mag ña wër ko . Mbote ma amoon na juróom - ñaari béjjén ak juróom - ñaari bët , ñu di juróom - ñaari Xeli Yàlla , yi ñu yónni ci àddina sépp .

text: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne .
text2: Mbote ma ñëw , jël téere , ba nekkoon ca loxol ndeyjooru ka toog ca gàngune ma .

text: And when he had taken the book , the four beasts and four and twenty elders fell down before the Lamb , having every one of them harps , and golden vials full of odours , which are the prayers of saints .
text2: Ba mu jëlee téere ba , ñeenti mbindeef ya ak ñaar - fukki mag ña ak ñeent daldi dëpp seen jë ca kanam Mbote ma , ku nekk yor xalam . Ñu yor it andi wurus yu fees ak cuuraay , yu doon misaal ñaani gaayi Yàlla ya .

text: And they sung a new song , saying , Thou art worthy to take the book , and to open the seals thereof : for thou wast slain , and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred , and tongue , and people , and nation ;
text2: Ñu daldi woy woy wu bees naan : « Yeyoo ngaa jël téere bite dindi tayu yi , ndaxte reyees na la , te jotal nga Yàlla ak sa deretay nit ñu bokk ci bépp giir , kàllaama , réew ak xeet .

text: And hast made us unto our God kings and priests : and we shall reign on the earth .
text2: Def nga leen askanu saraxalekatiBuur Yàlla sunu Boroom , di ko jaamu , te dinañu nguuru ci àddina . »

text: And I beheld , and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders : and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand , and thousands of thousands ;
text2: Ma xool noonu , dégg baatu malaaka yu bare yu ëppoon alfunniy alfunniy junniy junni . Malaaka ya wër gàngune ma ak mbindeef ya ak mag ña .

text: Saying with a loud voice , Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power , and riches , and wisdom , and strength , and honour , and glory , and blessing .
text2: Ñuy xaacu naan : « Mbote ma ñu rendi woonyeyoo na kàttan , alal , xel , doole , teraanga , ndam ak cant . »

text: And every creature which is in heaven , and on the earth , and under the earth , and such as are in the sea , and all that are in them , heard I saying , Blessing , and honour , and glory , and power , be unto him that sitteth upon the throne , and unto the Lamb for ever and ever .
text2: Ma dégg itam mbindeef , yi nekk ci asamaan , ci kaw suuf , ci biir suuf , ci géej gi , — mbindeef yépp naan : « Na cant , teraanga , ndam ak nguurféete ak ki toog ci gàngune mi , ak Mbote mi ba fàww . »

text: And the four beasts said , Amen . And the four and twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever .
text2: Ñeenti mbindeef ya naan : « Amiin . » Mag ña sukk di màggal .

text: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals , and I heard , as it were the noise of thunder , one of the four beasts saying , Come and see .
text2: Noonu ma gis Mbote ma dindi tayu gu jëkk ga , te ma daldi dégg kenn ca ñeenti mbindeef ya , di wax ak baat buy riir ni dënnu naan : « Ñëwal . »

text: And I saw , and behold a white horse : and he that sat on him had a bow ; and a crown was given unto him : and he went forth conquering , and to conquer .
text2: Ma xool noonu , gis fas wu weex , gawar ba yor ag fitt . Ñu jox ko kaalag ndam , mu daldi dem moom jàmbaar ngir daani .

text: And when he had opened the second seal , I heard the second beast say , Come and see .
text2: Mbote ma dindi na ñaareelu tayu ga , ma dégg ñaareelu mbindeef ma naan : « Ñëwal . »

text: And there went out another horse that was red : and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth , and that they should kill one another : and there was given unto him a great sword .
text2: Noonu weneen fas génn , di wu xonq , gawar ba jot sañ - sañu jële jàmm ci kaw suuf , ngir nit ñi di reyante ci seen biir . Ñu jox ko jaasi ju mag .

text: And when he had opened the third seal , I heard the third beast say , Come and see . And I beheld , and lo a black horse ; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand .
text2: Mu dindi ñetteelu tayu ga , ma dégg ñetteelu mbindeef ma ne : « Ñëwal . » Ma xool , gis fas wu ñuul , gawar ba yor ab peesekaay .

text: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say , A measure of wheat for a penny , and three measures of barley for a penny ; and see thou hurt not the oil and the wine .
text2: Ma dégg baat bu jollee ca diggante ñeenti mbindeef ya , naan : « Peyug bëccëgu lëmm ngir benn kilob ceeb , peyug bëccëgu lëmm ngir ñetti kiloy dugub , waaye bul yàq diw ak biiñ . »

text: And when he had opened the fourth seal , I heard the voice of the fourth beast say , Come and see .
text2: Mu dindi ñeenteelu tayu ga , ma dégg ñeenteelu mbindeef ma naan : « Ñëwal . »

text: And I looked , and behold a pale horse : and his name that sat on him was Death , and Hell followed with him . And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth , to kill with sword , and with hunger , and with death , and with the beasts of the earth .
text2: Ma xool noonu , gis fas wu wert , gawar baa nga tuddoon Dee te barsàq a nga toppoon ci moom . Ñu jox ko sañ - sañ ci ñeenteelu xaaju àddina sépp , ngir mu faat ak jaasi , xiif , mbas ak rabi àll yi .

text: And when he had opened the fifth seal , I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God , and for the testimony which they held :
text2: Mu dindi juróomeelu tayu ga , ma gis ca suufu saraxalukaay , ba ñuy taal cuuraay ca kawam , ruuwi ñi ñu bóom ndax seede si ñu doon sàmm ak li ñu gëmoon kàddug Yàlla .

text: And they cried with a loud voice , saying , How long , O Lord , holy and true , dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth ?
text2: Ñuy xaacu naan : « Boroom bu sell bi te dëggu , ba kañ ngay nég àtte bi te feyyul nu sunu deret ci waa àddina ? »

text: And white robes were given unto every one of them ; and it was said unto them , that they should rest yet for a little season , until their fellowservants also and their brethren , that should be killed as they were , should be fulfilled .
text2: Ñu jox leen ku nekk mbubb mu weex , daldi leen ne , ñu muñ tuuti , ba kera seeni nawle ñëw , te lim bi mat — seeni nawle ci liggéey bi , di seeni bokk yu waa àddina waroon a bóom ni ñoom .

text: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal , and , lo , there was a great earthquake ; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair , and the moon became as blood ;
text2: Ma xool , ba muy dindi juróom - benneelu tayu ga . Noonu mu am yengu - yengub suuf bu mag , jant bi ñuul ni këriñ , weer wi xonq curr ni deret .

text: And the stars of heaven fell unto the earth , even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs , when she is shaken of a mighty wind .
text2: Biddiiw yi fàqe asamaan , di daanu ci kaw suuf , ni doomi garab yu yolox di wadd , bu ko ngelaw lu metti dee yengal .

text: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together ; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places .
text2: Asamaan si dellu ni basaŋ gu ñuy taxañ , tund yépp ak dun yépp randoo fa ñu nekkoon .

text: And the kings of the earth , and the great men , and the rich men , and the chief captains , and the mighty men , and every bondman , and every free man , hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains ;
text2: Noonu buuri àddina si , kilifa yi , njiiti xare yi , boroom alal yi , boroom kàttan yi , jaam yi ak gor yi , ñépp làqatuji ci xunti yi ak ci ron doji tund yi .

text: And said to the mountains and rocks , Fall on us , and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne , and from the wrath of the Lamb :
text2: Ñu naan tund yi ak doj yi : « Daanuleen ci sunu kaw te nëbb nu bëti ki toog ci gàngune mi ak meru Mbote mi ,

text: For the great day of his wrath is come ; and who shall be able to stand ?
text2: ndaxte bés bu mag , bi seen mer di feeñ , agsi na ! Ku ci man a rëcc ? »

text: And after these things I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth , holding the four winds of the earth , that the wind should not blow on the earth , nor on the sea , nor on any tree .
text2: Gannaaw loolu ma gis ñeenti malaaka yu taxaw ci ñeenti xeblay àddina si . Ñu téye ñeenti ngelawi àddina , ngir ngelaw du wol ci kaw suuf , ci géej mbaa ci genn garab .

text: And I saw another angel ascending from the east , having the seal of the living God : and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels , to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea ,
text2: Ma gis it meneen malaaka , muy yéeg , jóge penku , yor màndargakaayu Yàlla jiy dund . Mu daldi wax ak baat bu xumb ñeenti malaaka ya ñu joxoon sañ - sañ , ñu yàq suuf ak géej ,

text: Saying , Hurt not the earth , neither the sea , nor the trees , till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads .
text2: ne leen : « Buleen yàqagun suuf si ak géej gi ak garab yi . Négleen , ba ñu def màndarga ci jëwu ñiy jaamu Yàlla sunu Boroom . »

text: And I heard the number of them which were sealed : and there were sealed an hundred and forty and four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel .
text2: Noonu ma dégg limub ñi ñu màndargaal ; ñu tollu ci téeméer ak ñeent - fukk ak ñeent ci ay junni . Ñu jóge ci giiri bànni Israyil yépp :

text: Of the tribe of Juda were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Reuben were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Gad were sealed twelve thousand .
text2: Fukki junni ak ñaar lañu màndargaal ci biir giiru Yuda , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Ruben , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Gàdd ,

text: Of the tribe of Aser were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Nepthalim were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Manasses were sealed twelve thousand .
text2: fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Aser , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Neftali , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Manase ,

text: Of the tribe of Simeon were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Levi were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Issachar were sealed twelve thousand .
text2: fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Simeyon , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Lewi , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Isakaar ,

text: Of the tribe of Zabulon were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Joseph were sealed twelve thousand . Of the tribe of Benjamin were sealed twelve thousand .
text2: fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Sabulon , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Yuusufa , fukki junni ak ñaar ci giiru Ben - yamin .

text: After this I beheld , and , lo , a great multitude , which no man could number , of all nations , and kindreds , and people , and tongues , stood before the throne , and before the Lamb , clothed with white robes , and palms in their hands ;
text2: Gannaaw loolu ma xool , gis mbooloo mu réy , ba kenn mënu koo waññ , ñu bokk ci xeet yépp , giir yépp , réew yépp ak kàllaama yépp , taxaw ca kanamu gàngune ma ak Mbote ma . Ñu sol ay mbubb yu weex , di màggal te di yengal ay cari garab ci seeni loxo ,

text: And cried with a loud voice , saying , Salvation to our God which sitteth upon the throne , and unto the Lamb .
text2: naan : « Mucc gaa ngi ci Yàllasunu Boroom , bi toog ci gàngune mi , ak ci Mbote mi ! »

text: And all the angels stood round about the throne , and about the elders and the four beasts , and fell before the throne on their faces , and worshipped God ,
text2: Noonu malaaka yépp taxaw , wër gàngune ma ak mag ña ak ñeenti mbindeef ya . Ñu dëpp seen jë ca kanamu gàngune ma , di jaamu Yàlla ,

text: Saying , Amen : Blessing , and glory , and wisdom , and thanksgiving , and honour , and power , and might , be unto our God for ever and ever . Amen .
text2: naan : « Amiin . Na cant ak ndam , xel ak ngërëm , teraanga , kàttan ak dooleféete ak Yàlla sunu Boroom ba fàww . Amiin ! »

text: And one of the elders answered , saying unto me , What are these which are arrayed in white robes ? and whence came they ?
text2: Noonu kenn ca mag ña ne ma : « Ñi sol mbubb yu weex yi , ñooy ñan ak fan lañu jóge ? »

text: And I said unto him , Sir , thou knowest . And he said to me , These are they which came out of great tribulation , and have washed their robes , and made them white in the blood of the Lamb .
text2: Ma ne ko : « Sang bi , xanaa yaa ko xam . » Mu ne ma : « Ñoo di ñi jóge ca metit wu réy wa . Fóot nañu seeni mbubb , ba weexal ko ci deretu Mbote ma .

text: Therefore are they before the throne of God , and serve him day and night in his temple : and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell among them .
text2: Loolu moo taxñu nekk ci kanamu gàngunem Yàlla , di ko jaamu guddi ak bëccëg ci këram , te ki toog ci gàngune mi dina leen yiir .

text: They shall hunger no more , neither thirst any more ; neither shall the sun light on them , nor any heat .
text2: Dootuñu xiif , dootuñu mar . Jant mbaa weneen tàngaay du leen lakk ,

text: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them , and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters : and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes .
text2: ndaxte Mbote mi nekk ci diggu gàngune mi dina leen sàmm , yóbbu leen ca bëti ndoxum dund ma , te Yàlla dina fomp bépp rangooñ ci seeni bët . »

text: And when he had opened the seventh seal , there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour .
text2: Mbote ma dindi na juróom - ñaareelu tayu ga , asamaan ne selaw lu mat genn - wàllu waxtu .

text: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God ; and to them were given seven trumpets .
text2: Noonu ma gis juróom - ñaari malaaka , yi taxaw ca kanam Yàlla , ñu daldi leen jox juróom - ñaari liit .

text: And another angel came and stood at the altar , having a golden censer ; and there was given unto him much incense , that he should offer it with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne .
text2: Ba loolu amee meneen malaaka ñëw , taxaw ca wetu saraxalukaayu wurus , ba ñuy taal cuuraay ca kawam , yor andu cuuraayu wurus . Ñu jox ko cuuraay lu bare , ngir mu boole ko ak ñaani gaayi Yàlla yépp , joxe ko ci kaw saraxalukaayu wurus ba nekk ci kanam gàngune mi .

text: And the smoke of the incense , which came with the prayers of the saints , ascended up before God out of the angel ' s hand .
text2: Noonu saxarus cuuraay li gillee ca loxob malaaka ma , ànd ak ñaani gaayi Yàlla ya , jëm ca kanam Yàlla .

text: And the angel took the censer , and filled it with fire of the altar , and cast it into the earth : and there were voices , and thunderings , and lightnings , and an earthquake .
text2: Malaaka ma jël andu cuuraay ba , duy ko ak ay xal ca saraxalukaay ba , daldi koy sànni ci àddina . Noonu mu am ay dënnu , ay riir , ay melax ak yengu - yengub suuf .

text: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound .
text2: Ba mu ko defee juróom - ñaari malaaka , ya yoroon juróom - ñaari liit ya , daldi defaru di waaj a liit .

text: The first angel sounded , and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood , and they were cast upon the earth : and the third part of trees was burnt up , and all green grass was burnt up .
text2: Malaaka mu jëkk ma wol liitam . Noonu ñu sànni ci àddina yuur ak safara yu ñu boole ak deret , ba tax benn ci ñetti xaaju suuf si lakk , benn ci ñetti xaaju garab yi it lakk , te ñax mu naat mépp lakk .

text: And the second angel sounded , and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea : and the third part of the sea became blood ;
text2: Ñaareelu malaaka ma wol liitam . Noonu ñu sànni lu mel ni tundu safara wu réy , mu daanu ci géej gi , benn ci ñetti xaaju géej gi soppiku deret ,

text: And the third part of the creatures which were in the sea , and had life , died ; and the third part of the ships were destroyed .
text2: benn ci ñetti xaaju mbindeef yi nekk ci géej gi dee , te benn ci ñetti xaaju gaal yi yàqu .

text: And the third angel sounded , and there fell a great star from heaven , burning as it were a lamp , and it fell upon the third part of the rivers , and upon the fountains of waters ;
text2: Ñetteelu malaaka ma wol liitam . Noonu biddiiw bu réy , yànj ni jum , xawee asamaan , daanu ci benn ci ñetti xaaju dex yi ak ci bëti ndox yi .

text: And the name of the star is called Wormwood : and the third part of the waters became wormwood ; and many men died of the waters , because they were made bitter .
text2: Biddiiw boobu mi ngi tuddoon Wextan . Nit ñu bare naan ci ndox mi daldi dee , ndaxte ndox mi dafa daldi wex .

text: And the fourth angel sounded , and the third part of the sun was smitten , and the third part of the moon , and the third part of the stars ; so as the third part of them was darkened , and the day shone not for a third part of it , and the night likewise .
text2: Ñeenteelu malaaka ma wol liitam . Noonu dóorees benn ci ñetti xaaju jant bi , ak benn ci ñetti xaaju weer wi , ak benn ci ñetti xaaju biddiiw yi , ba tax benn ci ñetti xaaju leer gi lëndëm . Bëccëg bi ñàkk leer diirub benn ci ñetti xaajam , guddi gi ñàkk leer diirub benn ci ñetti xaajam .

text: And I beheld , and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven , saying with a loud voice , Woe , woe , woe , to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels , which are yet to sound !
text2: Ma xool noonu , dégg jaxaay juy naaw ci digg asamaan , naan ak baat bu xumb : « Musiba , musiba ! Musibaa ngi ci kaw waa àddina , ndax liit yi yeneen ñetti malaaka yi di wol . »

text: And the fifth angel sounded , and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth : and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit .
text2: Juróomeelu malaaka ma wol liitam . Noonu ma gis , ñu jox caabiy kàmb gu xóot gi benn biddiiw bu xawee woon asamaan , daanu ci kaw suuf .

text: And he opened the bottomless pit ; and there arose a smoke out of the pit , as the smoke of a great furnace ; and the sun and the air were darkened by reason of the smoke of the pit .
text2: Biddiiw ba ubbi buntu kàmb gu xóot ga . Noonu saxar jollee ca , su mel ni saxarus puur bu mag , jant bi ak jaww ji lépp lëndëm ndax saxarus kàmb ga .

text: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth : and unto them was given power , as the scorpions of the earth have power .
text2: Ay njéeréer génn ca saxar sa , tasaaroo ci biir àddina . Ñu jox leen kàttan gu mel ni kàttanu jànkalaar .

text: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth , neither any green thing , neither any tree ; but only those men which have not the seal of God in their foreheads .
text2: Ñu sant leen , ñu bañ a laal ñax mi ci kaw suuf , mbaa genn gàncax walla genn meññeef , waaye ñu jublu rekk ci nit ñu amul màndargam Yàlla ci seen jë .

text: And to them it was given that they should not kill them , but that they should be tormented five months : and their torment was as the torment of a scorpion , when he striketh a man .
text2: Santuñu leen ñu rey leen , waaye ñu metital leen diirub juróomi weer . Te metit woowu ñuy indi , temboo na ak metit wiy dal nit , bu ko jànkalaar fittee .

text: And in those days shall men seek death , and shall not find it ; and shall desire to die , and death shall flee from them .
text2: Ca jamono yooya nit ñi dinañu sàkku dee , waaye duñu daje ak moom . Dinañu bëgg a dee , waaye dee da leen di daw .

text: And the shapes of the locusts were like unto horses prepared unto battle ; and on their heads were as it were crowns like gold , and their faces were as the faces of men .
text2: Njéeréer ya nag dañuy niroo ak fas yu ñu waajal ngir xare . Am nañu ci seen bopp lu mel ni kaalay wurus , te seen xar - kanam mel ni gu nit .

text: And they had hair as the hair of women , and their teeth were as the teeth of lions .
text2: Seeni kawar mel ni yu jigéen , seeni bëñ mel ni bëñi gaynde .

text: And they had breastplates , as it were breastplates of iron ; and the sound of their wings was as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle .
text2: Takk nañu ci seen dënn lu mel ni kiiraayu weñ , te coow la seeni laaf di def mel ni coowu sareeti xare yu bare yu ñu takk fas , di xeexi .

text: And they had tails like unto scorpions , and there were stings in their tails : and their power was to hurt men five months .
text2: Am nañu ay geen yu am ay fitt ni jànkalaar , te ca la seen kàttan nekk , ngir metital nit ñi diirub juróomi weer .

text: And they had a king over them , which is the angel of the bottomless pit , whose name in the Hebrew tongue is Abaddon , but in the Greek tongue hath his name Apollyon .
text2: Buuru njéeréer yi mooy malaakam kàmb gu xóot gi , moom lañu tudde ci làkku Yawut , Abadon , ak ci làkku gereg , Apolyon , liy tekki « Yàqkat . »

text: One woe is past ; and , behold , there come two woes more hereafter .
text2: Musiba mu jëkk mi jàll na , yeneen ñaari musiba yaa ngi ñëw .

text: And the sixth angel sounded , and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God ,
text2: Juróom - benneelu malaaka ma wol liitam . Noonu ma dégg baat bu jóge ci ñeenti béjjén , yi nekk ci koñi saraxalukaayu wurus , ba nekk ci kanam Yàlla ,

text: Saying to the sixth angel which had the trumpet , Loose the four angels which are bound in the great river Euphrates .
text2: mu ne juróom - benneelu malaaka , ma yoroon liit : « Yiwil ñeenti malaaka , ya yeewe ca Efraat , dex gu mag ga . »

text: And the four angels were loosed , which were prepared for an hour , and a day , and a month , and a year , for to slay the third part of men .
text2: Noonu ñu daldi yiwi ñeenti malaaka , ya ñu waajaloon ngir at moomu , weer woowu , bés boobu ak waxtu woowu , ngir ñu rey benn ci ñetti xaaju nit ñi .

text: And the number of the army of the horsemen were two hundred thousand thousand : and I heard the number of them .
text2: Limub gawar ga doon xareji mat na ñaari alfunniy alfunni . Dégg naa lim ba .

text: And thus I saw the horses in the vision , and them that sat on them , having breastplates of fire , and of jacinth , and brimstone : and the heads of the horses were as the heads of lions ; and out of their mouths issued fire and smoke and brimstone .
text2: Nii laa gise ci peeñu mi fas ya ak ña leen war : ñu sol kiiraay yu xonq ni safara , bulo ni saxar , ak mboq ni tamarax . Boppi fas yaa nga doon nirook boppi gaynde ; safara , saxar ak tamarax di génn ci seeni gémmiñ .

text: By these three was the third part of men killed , by the fire , and by the smoke , and by the brimstone , which issued out of their mouths .
text2: Benn ci ñetti xaaju nit ñi dee ci ñetti musiba ya : ci safara , saxar ak tamarax yi génn ci seeni gémmiñ .

text: For their power is in their mouth , and in their tails : for their tails were like unto serpents , and had heads , and with them they do hurt .
text2: Ndaxte kàttanu fas yaa ngi ci seeni gémmiñ ak ci seeni geen . Geen yaa nga mel ni ay jaan , am ay bopp , te ñoom lañuy metitale nit ñi .

text: And the rest of the men which were not killed by these plagues yet repented not of the works of their hands , that they should not worship devils , and idols of gold , and silver , and brass , and stone , and of wood : which neither can see , nor hear , nor walk :
text2: Nit ñi rëcc ci musiba yooyu taxul sax ñu tuub seeni jëfi loxo . Noppiwuñu di jaamu rab yi ak nataali xërëm yu ñu defare wurus ak xaalis ak xànjar ak xeer ak dénk , yoo xam ne mënuñoo gis , mënuñoo dégg mbaa ñu dox .

text: Neither repented they of their murders , nor of their sorceries , nor of their fornication , nor of their thefts .
text2: Te nit ñooñu tuubuñu seen bóom , seen xërëm , seen njaaloo mbaa seen càcc .

text: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven , clothed with a cloud : and a rainbow was upon his head , and his face was as it were the sun , and his feet as pillars of fire :
text2: Noonu ma gis meneen malaaka mu am doole , muy wàcce asamaan , làmboo niir . Xon tiim ko , te xar - kanamam mel ni jant , te ay tànkam mel ni jumi safara .

text: And he had in his hand a little book open : and he set his right foot upon the sea , and his left foot on the earth ,
text2: Yor na benn téere bu ndaw bu ñu ubbi . Mu teg tànku ndeyjooram ci géej gi , tànku càmmooñam ci suuf si ,

text: And cried with a loud voice , as when a lion roareth : and when he had cried , seven thunders uttered their voices .
text2: di xaacu , mel ni gaynde guy yëmmu . Naka la xaacu , juróom - ñaari dënnu yi jib .

text: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices , I was about to write : and I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me , Seal up those things which the seven thunders uttered , and write them not .
text2: Naka la juróom - ñaari dënnu yi di jib , may waaj a bind , waaye ma dégg baat bu jóge asamaan , naan ma : « Li juróom - ñaari dënnu yi wax , na nekk kumpa , bu ko bind . »

text: And the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven ,
text2: Noonu malaaka ma ma gis , mu taxaw ci géej gi ak suuf si , yékkati loxol ndeyjooram , mu jëm asamaan ,

text: And sware by him that liveth for ever and ever , who created heaven , and the things that therein are , and the earth , and the things that therein are , and the sea , and the things which are therein , that there should be time no longer :
text2: daldi waat ci kiy dund ba fàww , ki sàkk asamaan ak suuf ak géej ak li ci nekk lépp ; mu ne : « Négandiku wees na ,

text: But in the days of the voice of the seventh angel , when he shall begin to sound , the mystery of God should be finished , as he hath declared to his servants the prophets .
text2: waaye jamono ju juróom - ñaareelu malaaka ma wolee ci liitam , ndogalu Yàlla dina mat , ni mu ko waxe woon ay jaamam , yonent yi . »

text: And the voice which I heard from heaven spake unto me again , and said , Go and take the little book which is open in the hand of the angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth .
text2: Ci kaw loolu baat , ba ma déggoon ca asamaan waxaat ak man , ne ma : « Demal jël téere bi ñu ubbi ci loxob malaaka , mi taxaw ci géej gi ak suuf si . »

text: And I went unto the angel , and said unto him , Give me the little book . And he said unto me , Take it , and eat it up ; and it shall make thy belly bitter , but it shall be in thy mouth sweet as honey .
text2: Ma dem ca malaaka ma , laaj ko téere bu ndaw boobu . Mu ne ma : « Jël ko te lekk ko . Dina wex ci sa biir , waaye dina neex ni lem ci sa gémmiñ . »

text: And I took the little book out of the angel ' s hand , and ate it up ; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey : and as soon as I had eaten it , my belly was bitter .
text2: Noonu ma jël téere bi ci loxob malaaka mi , daldi ko lekk , mu neex ci sama gémmiñ ni lem , waaye bi ma ko wannee , mu wex xat ci sama biir .

text: And he said unto me , Thou must prophesy again before many peoples , and nations , and tongues , and kings .
text2: Gannaaw loolu ñu ne ma : « Fàww nga wax ci kàddug Yàlla lu jëm ci réew yu bare , xeet yu bare , kàllaama yu bare ak buur yu bare . »

text: And there was given me a reed like unto a rod : and the angel stood , saying , Rise , and measure the temple of God , and the altar , and them that worship therein .
text2: Bi loolu amee ñu jox ma nattukaay bu mel ni yet , ne ma : « Jógal , natt kër Yàlla gi ak saraxalukaay bi , te waññ ña fay jaamu Yàlla .

text: But the court which is without the temple leave out , and measure it not ; for it is given unto the Gentiles : and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty and two months .
text2: Waaye bàyyil ëttu bitib kër Yàlla gi ; bu ko natt , ndaxte jébbalees na ko ñi dul Yawut , te dinañu nappaaje dëkk bu sell bi diirub ñeent - fukki weer ak ñaar .

text: And I will give power unto my two witnesses , and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and threescore days , clothed in sackcloth .
text2: Dinaa may sama ñaari seede yi , ñuy wax ci kàddug Yàlla , sol ay saaku , di toroxlu diirub junni ak ñaari téeméeri fan ak juróom - benn - fukk . »

text: These are the two olive trees , and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth .
text2: Ñaari seede ya nag ñoo di ñaari garabu oliw yeek ñaari làmpu diwlin , yi taxaw ci kanam Boroom suuf si .

text: And if any man will hurt them , fire proceedeth out of their mouth , and devoureth their enemies : and if any man will hurt them , he must in this manner be killed .
text2: Su leen kenn bëggee def lu bon , safaraay génn ci seen gémmiñ , daldi lakk seeni bañaale ; te ku leen bëgg a def lu bon , noonu lay war a deeye .

text: These have power to shut heaven , that it rain not in the days of their prophecy : and have power over waters to turn them to blood , and to smite the earth with all plagues , as often as they will .
text2: Am nañu sañ - sañu téye taw diirub fan , yi ñuy wax ci kàddug Yàlla . Am nañu it sañ - sañu soppi ndox yi deret te wàcce ci kaw suuf musiba yu nekk , saa su ñu ko bëggee .

text: And when they shall have finished their testimony , the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them , and shall overcome them , and kill them .
text2: Bu ñu noppee seen seede , rab wiy jóge ci kàmb gi dina leen xeex , daan leen , rey leen .

text: And their dead bodies shall lie in the street of the great city , which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt , where also our Lord was crucified .
text2: Te seeni néew dinañu nekk ci péncum dëkk bu mag , boobu ñuy wooye ci misaal Sodom ak it Misra , fa ñu reyoon seen Boroom ci bant .

text: And they of the people and kindreds and tongues and nations shall see their dead bodies three days and an half , and shall not suffer their dead bodies to be put in graves .
text2: Te diirub ñetti fan ak genn - wàll bépp réew , giir , kàllaama ak xeet dinañu seetaan seeni néew te duñu bàyyi kenn suul leen .

text: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them , and make merry , and shall send gifts one to another ; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth .
text2: Waa àddina dinañu bég ci seen dee , di ndokkeelante ak di joqleente ay may , ndaxte ñaari yonent ya lakkaloon nañu waa àddina .

text: And after three days and an half the Spirit of life from God entered into them , and they stood upon their feet ; and great fear fell upon them which saw them .
text2: Waaye bi ñetti fan ya ak genn - wàll wéyee , xelum dund , jóge ca Yàlla , solu leen , ñu jóg taxaw . Noonu tiitaange gu réy jàpp ñi leen doon seetaan .

text: And they heard a great voice from heaven saying unto them , Come up hither . And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud ; and their enemies beheld them .
text2: Ñaari seede ya dégg baat bu xumb ca asamaan naan leen : « Yéegleen fii . » Noonu ñu yéeg asamaan ci aw niir , seeni bañaale di seetaan .

text: And the same hour was there a great earthquake , and the tenth part of the city fell , and in the earthquake were slain of men seven thousand : and the remnant were affrighted , and gave glory to the God of heaven .
text2: Ca saa sa am yengu - yengub suuf bu mag , te benn ci fukki xaaju dëkk ba daldi màbb . Juróom - ñaari junniy nit dee ci yengu - yengub suuf ba , te ña ca des tiit , daldi màggal Yàllay asamaan .

text: The second woe is past ; and , behold , the third woe cometh quickly .
text2: Ñaareelu musiba mi wéy na , ñetteel baa ngi nii di ñëw .

text: And the seventh angel sounded ; and there were great voices in heaven , saying , The kingdoms of this world are become the kingdoms of our Lord , and of his Christ ; and he shall reign for ever and ever .
text2: Juróom - ñaareelu malaaka ma wol liitam , noonu baat yu xumb jib ca asamaan naan : « Nguuru àddina , jébbalaat nañu kosunu Boroom ak Almaseem , te dina nguuru ba fàww . »

text: And the four and twenty elders , which sat before God on their seats , fell upon their faces , and worshipped God ,
text2: Ñaar - fukki mag ak ñeent , ña toogoon ca seen gàngune ca kanam Yàlla , daldi dëpp seen jë ca suuf , jaamu Yàlla ,

text: Saying , We give thee thanks , O Lord God Almighty , which art , and wast , and art to come ; because thou hast taken to thee thy great power , and hast reigned .
text2: naan : « Nu ngi lay gërëm , Boroom bi Yàlla , yaw Aji Kàttan ji , ki nekk te nekkoon , ndax gànjoo nga sa kàttan gu réy gi , ngir taxawal sa nguur .

text: And the nations were angry , and thy wrath is come , and the time of the dead , that they should be judged , and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets , and to the saints , and them that fear thy name , small and great ; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth .
text2: Xeet yi meroon nañu , waaye sa mer wàcc na , te jamono ji jot na , ji ngay àttee ñi dee , neexal say jaam yonent yi , ak sa gaa ñi ak ñi ragal saw tur , muy mag di ndaw , te nga rey ñiy yàq àddina . »

text: And the temple of God was opened in heaven , and there was seen in his temple the ark of his testament : and there were lightnings , and voices , and thunderings , and an earthquake , and great hail .
text2: Noonu kër Yàlla gi ci asamaan daldi ubbiku , gaalu kóllëreg Yàlla ga daldi feeñ ca biir kër Yàlla ga , te mu daldi am ay melax , ay coow , ay dënnu , yengu - yengub suuf ak tawu yuur bu metti .

text: And there appeared a great wonder in heaven ; a woman clothed with the sun , and the moon under her feet , and upon her head a crown of twelve stars :
text2: Amoon na firnde ju ràññiku ju feeñ ca asamaan , di jigéen ju làmboo jant bi , kaalawoo fukki biddiiw ak ñaar , weer wi nekk ci suufu tànkam .

text: And she being with child cried , travailing in birth , and pained to be delivered .
text2: Jigéenu biir la , di yuuxu ndax metitu mat wu tar .

text: And there appeared another wonder in heaven ; and behold a great red dragon , having seven heads and ten horns , and seven crowns upon his heads .
text2: Noonu beneen firnde feeñ ca asamaan , di ninkinànka ju réy , xonq curr te am juróom - ñaari bopp ak fukki béjjén . Ca bopp ya am na juróom - ñaari mbaxanay buur .

text: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven , and did cast them to the earth : and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered , for to devour her child as soon as it was born .
text2: Geenam di laawaale ñetti cér yu ne benn ca biddiiwi asamaan , di leen sànni ci suuf . Ninkinànka ja taxaw ca kanamu jigéen jay matu , ngir lekk liir ba , bu juddoo .

text: And she brought forth a man child , who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron : and her child was caught up unto God , and to his throne .
text2: Noonu mu jur doom ju góor , muy ki war a jiite xeeti àddina yépp ak yetu weñ . Waaye ñu daldi fëkk doom ja , mu dem ca Yàlla ak gànguneem .

text: And the woman fled into the wilderness , where she hath a place prepared of God , that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and threescore days .
text2: Gannaaw loolu jigéen ja daw , dem ca màndiŋ ma , ca dalukaay ba ko Yàlla waajaloon ngir mu nekk fa , ñu dundal ko fa diirub junni ak ñaari téeméeri fan ak juróom - benn - fukk .

text: And there was war in heaven : Michael and his angels fought against the dragon ; and the dragon fought and his angels ,
text2: Noonu xare am ca asamaan ya . Mikayel ak malaaka , ya ànd ak moom , xeex ak ninkinànka ja , ninkinànka ja it ak ay malaakaam feyyu .

text: And prevailed not ; neither was their place found any more in heaven .
text2: Waaye ninkinànka jaa gën a néew doole ; noonu ñu dàqe ko ak toppam asamaan .

text: And the great dragon was cast out , that old serpent , called the Devil , and Satan , which deceiveth the whole world : he was cast out into the earth , and his angels were cast out with him .
text2: Daaneel nañu ko , moom ninkinànka ju réy ji , di jaani cosaan ji , te ñu di ko wax Tuumaalkat bi mbaa Seytaane , moom miy nax waa àddina sépp — daaneel nañu ko ci kaw suuf , moom ak ay malaakaam .

text: And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven , Now is come salvation , and strength , and the kingdom of our God , and the power of his Christ : for the accuser of our brethren is cast down , which accused them before our God day and night .
text2: Noonu ma dégg baat bu xumb jóge asamaan naan : « Léegi mucc agsi na , moom ak kàttanak nguuru Yàlla sunu Boroom , ak sañ - sañu Almaseem , ndaxte ki daan tuumaal sunuy bokk , di leen sosal guddi ak bëccëgci kanam Yàlla sunu Boroom , kooka daaneel nañu ko .

text: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb , and by the word of their testimony ; and they loved not their lives unto the death .
text2: Fekk noot nañu kojaarale ko ci deretu Mbote maak seen seedes ngëm , te soppuñu seen bakkan ba ragal a dee .

text: Therefore rejoice , ye heavens , and ye that dwell in them . Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea ! for the devil is come down unto you , having great wrath , because he knoweth that he hath but a short time .
text2: Looloo tax , na asamaanak ñi ci dëkk bànneexu ! Musiba ci kaw suuf ak ci biir géej ! Ndaxte Seytaane wàcc na ci yéen , ànd ak mer mu tàng , ndaxte xam na ne , jot gi ko dese barewul . »

text: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth , he persecuted the woman which brought forth the man child .
text2: Ba ninkinànka ja gisee ne , daaneel nañu ko ci kaw suuf , mu dàq jigéen , ja juroon doom ju góor ja .

text: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle , that she might fly into the wilderness , into her place , where she is nourished for a time , and times , and half a time , from the face of the serpent .
text2: Noonu ñu jox jigéen ja ñaari laafi jaxaay ja , ngir mu naaw , ba sore ninkinànka ja , dem ca màndiŋ ma ca bérabam , ñu dundal ko fa ab diir , ay diir ak genn - wàllu diir .

text: And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman , that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood .
text2: Ninkinànka ja buusu ndox mu bare ni dex ca gannaaw jigéen ja , ngir yóbbaale ko ca .

text: And the earth helped the woman , and the earth opened her mouth , and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth .
text2: Waaye suuf wallu jigéen ja , naan dex , ga ninkinànka ja buusu woon .

text: And the dragon was wroth with the woman , and went to make war with the remnant of her seed , which keep the commandments of God , and have the testimony of Jesus Christ .
text2: Ninkinànka ja mere jigéen ja , daldi xeexi ak ñi des ciy doomam , di ñiy sàmm ndigali Yàlla tey sax ci di seedeel Yeesu .

text: And I stood upon the sand of the sea , and saw a beast rise up out of the sea , having seven heads and ten horns , and upon his horns ten crowns , and upon his heads the name of blasphemy .
text2: Noonu ma gis génn ca géej ga , rab wu am fukki béjjén ak juróom - ñaari bopp . Ci kaw béjjénam ya amoon na fukki mbaxanay buur ; ca bopp ya turi xarab Yàlla .

text: And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard , and his feet were as the feet of a bear , and his mouth as the mouth of a lion : and the dragon gave him his power , and his seat , and great authority .
text2: Rab wa ma gis ma nga mel ni segg , tànk ya mel ni yu rab wu ñuy wax urs , gémmiñ ga mel ni gu gaynde . Ninkinànka ja jox ko kàttanam , nguuram ak sañ - sañam bu réy .

text: And I saw one of his heads as it were wounded to death ; and his deadly wound was healed : and all the world wondered after the beast .
text2: Benn ca bopp ya mel ni dafa gaañu ba dee . Waaye gaañu - gaañu ba daldi wér . Waa àddina sépp yéemu , daldi topp rab wa .

text: And they worshipped the dragon which gave power unto the beast : and they worshipped the beast , saying , Who is like unto the beast ? who is able to make war with him ?
text2: Ñu jaamu ninkinànka ja ndax li mu joxoon sañ - sañ rab wa , di jaamu it rab wa , naan : « Rab wi amul moroom , kenn mënul a xeex ak moom . »

text: And there was given unto him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies ; and power was given unto him to continue forty and two months .
text2: Noonu mayees ko mu am gémmiñ , muy jey boppam te di xarab turu Yàlla . Mayees ko it sañ - sañu jëf ci kaw suuf diirub ñeent - fukki weer ak ñaar .

text: And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God , to blaspheme his name , and his tabernacle , and them that dwell in heaven .
text2: Noonu mu tàmbalee xarab Yàlla , di xarab aw turam , dalam , ak ñi dëkk ci asamaan .

text: And it was given unto him to make war with the saints , and to overcome them : and power was given him over all kindreds , and tongues , and nations .
text2: Mayees ko , mu xare ak gaayi Yàlla yi te noot leen . Mayees ko it sañ - sañ ci kaw bépp giir , réew , kàllaama ak xeet .

text: And all that dwell upon the earth shall worship him , whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world .
text2: Waa àddina sépp dinañu ko jaamu , ñooñu ñu bindul seeni tur , li dale ci njàlbéenu àddina , ci téereb dund bu Mbote mi ñu rendi .

text: If any man have an ear , let him hear .
text2: Yaw mi am ay nopp , déglul .

text: He that leadeth into captivity shall go into captivity : he that killeth with the sword must be killed with the sword . Here is the patience and the faith of the saints .
text2: Ku Yàlla dogal , ñu war laa jàpp njaam , dinañu la jàpp njaam . Ku Yàlla dogal , ñu war laa rey ak jaasi , dinañu la rey ak jaasi . Looloo tax gaayi Yàlla yi war a muñ te takku .

text: And I beheld another beast coming up out of the earth ; and he had two horns like a lamb , and he spake as a dragon .
text2: Noonu ma gis weneen rab di génn ci suuf . Am na ñaari béjjén yu mel ni yu mbote , waaye di wax ni ninkinànka .

text: And he exerciseth all the power of the first beast before him , and causeth the earth and them which dwell therein to worship the first beast , whose deadly wound was healed .
text2: Muy jëf ak sañ - sañu rab wu jëkk wa ci turam , di sant waa àddina sépp , ñu jaamu rab wu jëkk , woowu am gaañu - gaañu ba ko rey , waaye daldi wér .

text: And he doeth great wonders , so that he maketh fire come down from heaven on the earth in the sight of men ,
text2: Muy def kéemaan yu réy , ba dem sax bay wàcce ci kaw suuf safara su jóge asamaan , nit ñi di gis .

text: And deceiveth them that dwell on the earth by the means of those miracles which he had power to do in the sight of the beast ; saying to them that dwell on the earth , that they should make an image to the beast , which had the wound by a sword , and did live .
